subject: funded phd position at stuttgart  university
content: we are looking for a student interested to pursue research in imitation and reinforcement learning. the candidates must hold a master's degree in one of the following fields: computer science, robotics, engineering or physics. excellent academic track record in the masters is required. a good scientific culture, strong skills in mathematics, and a good level of english are also required. previous participation in scientific work with or without publications would be highly appreciated, as well as experience with programming languages (c++ and python) and deep learning frameworks (e.g., tensorflow, torch, caffe). the position is within the humans to robots movement (hrm) research group of the machine learning & robotics laboratory. located at the university of stuttgart, the laboratory is equipped with pr2 and baxter robots and a motion capture system. the position is funded by the university for 3 years. how to apply: to send by e-mail to hrm.jobs at ipvs.uni-stuttgart.de : * motivation letter (1 page max.). * cv (please include: your nationality for visa requirements, date of birth, your english level, list of scientific publications if any). * list of at least 2 referees (support-letter writers). these referees will be contacted only in case your application is considered. --  jim mainprice, phd research group leader, stuttgart university research scientist, max planck institute for intelligent systems https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__ipvs.informatik.uni-2dstuttgart.de_mlr_hrm_&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=fff-ywrruwq04t5hnoxkqikskbzrevgxppf3hdplkkg&s=i6u0-ugr5ijsqpvfony5p2ay5cqphx6maislqb0rqr8&e=

subject: postdoc position in the field of  interactive machine learning at cor-lab, bielefeld university
content: for the newly started project cluster cinementas - cooperative  interaction based on mental models for assistive systems we solicit  several research positions with salary paid according to german tvl-13.  project duration is 36 months. cinementas is focused on the research question how learning by a  technical system in interaction with a human can be shaped to remain  transparent for the human user. to achieve this goal cinementas connects  machine learning approaches with concepts from cognitive science, such  as mental models. cinementas is located at the institute for cognition and robotics  (cor-lab) and embedded in the research environment of the cluster of  excellence cognitive interaction technology (citec), both at bielefeld  university, germany. project work will be in close cooperation with the  honda research institute europe (hri, located in offenbach near  frankfurt/main), which also provides the financial funding of the project. the project is consists of five subprojects affiliated with five  research groups at the faculty of technology and at the faculty of  linguistics and literary science at bielefeld university. the present  postdoc position is dedicated to cinementas subproject cognitive  corridor learning (cocolea, prof. dr. helge ritter, ag neuroinformatics). aim of cocolea is the development of innovative strategies and  algorithms that allow to? constrain interactive machine learning within  a "corridor of readability" for the human user. underlying idea is to  exploit the redundancy of the solution space for a learning task and to  benefit from cognitive science concepts, in particular mental models, to  shape learning towards maximal understandability for the human. scope of functions: research activities (85 %):  ?- development and implementation of algorithms to realize interactive  machine learning within a corridor of readability for the human user.  ?- technical realization of a prototype system within the chosen  demonstrator scenario and environment  ?- design and conduct of empirical user studies for data acquisition  and evaluation of the model/system other acticvities (15 %):  ?- reporting and collaboration with project partners, especially hri  ?- preparation of scientific publications and presentations  ?- if necessary and thematically related to the project's research  topic, supervision of bachelor/master theses and student projects applicants are required to have a qualified phd in a pertinent topic  area within the fields of machine learning or human-machine interaction,  and an excellent diploma or master degree in informatics/computer  science or in a pertinent neighbor discipline, obtained at a research  university. we expect  ?- solid practical and theoretical expertise in machine learning,  particularly in the context of interactive settings  ?- a good publication record in pertinent international conferences  and/or scientific journals  ?- excellent programming skills (c++,python,matlab),  ?- capability for interdisciplinary cooperation  ?- team orientation and a strong motivation to integrate results in the  form of implemented software components in a shared demonstrator system  ?- good command of english in writing and speaking we further appreciate a background in cognitive science concepts about  learning and mental representations and a keen interest and willingness to learn across discipline borders. work in the project will proceed in close connection with four other  cinementas projects (cf. connected advertisements) mental models for collaborative reinforcement learning (prof. dr. stefan  kopp, ag cognitive systems and social interaction) mental models of the validity of adaptive systems (prof. dr. barbara  hammer, ag?? machine learning) collaborating on learning to classify (prof. dr. david schlangen, ag  applied computer linguistics) learning of co-constructed interactive signals in joint tasks (prof. dr.  britta wrede,?? ag applied computer science) research work in the project will include temporary stays at the honda  research institute europe located in offenbach near frankfurt/main  (about 4h train distance from bielefeld) please send your application, preferably by? e-mail in a single  pdf-document no later than oct-15 2017 to: prof. dr. helge ritter secretary mrs. susanne strunk sstrunk at techfak.uni-bielefeld.de faculty of technology bielefeld university postfach 100131 33501 bielefeld questions can be directed to prof. dr. helge ritter +495211061212 helge at techfak.uni-bielefeld.de

subject: phd fellowships at the max planck eth  center for learning systems
content: the max planck eth center for learning systems is a joint research center of eth zurich and the max planck society. the center?s mission is to pursue research in the design and analysis of learning systems, synthetic or natural. this initiative brings together more than 40 professors and senior researchers in the fields of machine learning, perception, robotics on large and small scales, as well as neuroscience. we offer phd fellowships at the max planck eth center for learning systems<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__apply.refline.ch_845721_5692_pub_1_index.html&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=khp_kvc6nrouvanvjelzgmxw9e64nsabfulefpkkxcg&s=gbwt2xgo7lvb1fsvmrdnlatw3utufpj9hjthjrf2xmc&e=> the center offers a unique fellowship program, where phd students are co-supervised by one advisor from eth zurich and one from the mpi for intelligent systems in tu?bingen and stuttgart. phd students are expected to take advantage of the opportunities offered by both organizations and to actively seek cross-group collaborations. the center also offers a wide range of activities like retreats, workshops, and summer schools, as well as the possibility to engage in organizing such events. this is an exciting new program and admission is highly competitive. each phd fellow will have a primary location (chosen based on interests and match) and spends one year at the other location as well. fellowships will be remunerated through employment contracts, subjected to the rules of the max-planck-society and eth zurich, respectively. all phd fellows will register as graduate students at eth zurich and - upon successful completion of their phd project - be granted a doctoral degree by eth zurich. details of this process are governed by eth regulations and committees. we encourage applications from outstanding candidates with academic backgrounds in mathematics, physics, computer science, engineering, materials science, neuroscience and related fields, and a keen interest in doing basic research in areas like: machine learning and empirical inference of complex systems, machine intelligence, including machine vision and natural language understanding, perception-action-cycle for autonomous systems, robust model-based control for intelligent behavior, robust perception in complex environments, design, fabrication, and control of synthetic, bio-inspired, and bio-hybrid micro/nanoscale robotic systems, haptic intelligence, data-driven computational biology, or neurotechnology and emergent intelligence in nervous systems. we seek to increase the number of women in areas where they are underrepresented and therefore explicitly encourage women to apply. furthermore, we are committed to increasing the number of individuals with disabilities in its workforce and therefore encourage applications from such qualified individuals. we are looking forward to receiving your online application consisting of a complete cv (incl. a list of publications, talks and awards), a short mission statement (max. 1-2 pages) outlining your research interests, and scanned transcripts of certificates (bachelor?s degree, master?s degree, other degrees). please note that we exclusively accept applications submitted through our online application portal. applications via email or postal services will not be considered. please arrange for 2-3 reference letters to be sent directly per email to dr. magdalena seebauer within the application deadline. the deadline for applications is november 7, 2017. the selection interviews will take place on january 18 and january 19, 2018 at the max planck campus in t?bingen, germany. for further information please contact dr. magdalena seebauer at magdalena.seebauer at inf.ethz.ch<mailto:magdalena.seebauer at inf.ethz.ch> (no application documents) or visit our website https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__learning-2dsystems.org_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=khp_kvc6nrouvanvjelzgmxw9e64nsabfulefpkkxcg&s=up1zrafwotwc_xlr_gnl7rysxmtdn-pu9vt26nxlboc&e=. apply online here<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__apply.refline.ch_845721_5692_pub_1_index.html&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=khp_kvc6nrouvanvjelzgmxw9e64nsabfulefpkkxcg&s=gbwt2xgo7lvb1fsvmrdnlatw3utufpj9hjthjrf2xmc&e=>.

subject: doctoral position in biomechanics and  robotics at technical university darmstadt
content: *open biomechanics & robotics positions* the lauflabor locomotion lab (www.lauflabor.de  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__lauflabor.ifs-2dtud.de_&d=dwmdaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_ihe7yi1y_vfyp3bjt0vzr9tofynk5u17exuaapbrqe&s=jpnah3yqr-6obykooj5ugohmisxjscfdtvumz-phbzg&e=>)  at the technical university darmstadt (tu darmstadt) invites highly  talented candidates to apply for *ph.d. students* with strong interests  in one the following research topics: ?bioinspired legged locomotion ?biomechanical modeling of legged systems ?robot control ?neuromuscular modeling of biological locomotor systems ?soft robotics students and researchers from the areas of robotics, mechanical  electrical and computer engineering including system design and control,  biomechanics and learning are welcome to apply. the candidates are  expected to conduct independent research and at the same time contribute  to ongoing projects in the areas listed above. successful candidates can  furthermore be given the opportunity to work with undergraduate and  m.sc. students. *available ph.d position* currently there are phd positions available in a dfg granted project  (epa project, summary given here  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__lauflabor.ifs-2dtud.de_doku.php-3fid-3dprojects-3aprojects-5fepa&d=dwmdaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_ihe7yi1y_vfyp3bjt0vzr9tofynk5u17exuaapbrqe&s=v9fn85vrcnzjzsa15l3_bkbu1exmza-omkzdranhyi0&e=>).  in this project, a collaboration with hosoda lab  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www-2darl.sys.es.osaka-2du.ac.jp_&d=dwmdaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_ihe7yi1y_vfyp3bjt0vzr9tofynk5u17exuaapbrqe&s=miy7hgmxbwp77auvp_wosojnnwqtizjqnscjlqh9ubu&e=> in  university of osaka is foreseen. *position requirements* ph.d. position applicants need to have a master's degree in a relevant  field (e.g., robotics, mechanical/electrical engineering or computer  science) and have exhibited their ability to perform research in either  robotics or biomechanics. the required language to speak in the lab is english. we do not need  tofel or ielts (if you have any certificate, please submit with other  documents), but the quality of your language matters which will be  evaluated in the interview at the final round of admission. expertise in any of the following items is a big plus for all applicants: ?working with robot systems or assistive devices ?modeling in opensim ?performing human experiment and data analysis *how to apply?* to apply, please send a research statement, a pdf with the cv, degrees,  and grade-sheets,the names and contact information of two references,  and your one or two strongest publications directly to  ll_jobs at sport.tu-darmstadt.de <mailto:ll_jobs at sport.tu-darmstadt.de>.  please write this sentence in the subject of your email ?application for  phd in epa project?. review of applications will begin immediately and will continue until  the position is filled. /please explain your research interest and experience, how these relate  to lauflabor and epa project and how they relate to the topics listed  above, in your research statement./

subject: funded ph.d. positions at the new  international max planck research school for intelligent systems
content: funded ph.d. positions at the new international max planck research school for intelligent systems  the max planck institute for intelligent systems and the universities of stuttgart and t?bingen are collaborating to offer a new interdisciplinary ph.d. program, the international max planck research school for intelligent systems. this new doctoral program will be accepting its new generation of ph.d. students in spring 2018 and will enroll about 100 ph.d. students over the next six years. this school is a key element of baden-w?rttemberg?s ?cyber valley? initiative to accelerate basic research and commercial development in artificial intelligence. we seek students who want to earn a doctorate while contributing to world-leading research in areas such as - computer vision - machine learning - robotics - haptics - control systems - perceptual inference - computer graphics - micro- and nano-robotics the participating faculty are frank allg?wer, matthias bethge, michael j. black, andr?s bruhn, peer fischer, andreas geiger, philipp hennig, katherine j. kuchenbecker, hendrik lensch, georg martius, ludovic righetti, stefan schaal, bernhard sch?lkopf, metin sitti, alexander spr?witz, ingo steinwart, marc toussaint, ulrike von luxburg, and felix wichmann.  intelligent systems that can successfully perceive, act, and learn in complex environments hold great potential for aiding society. to advance human knowledge in this domain, we need doctoral students who are curious, creative, and passionate about research to join our school.  learn more at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__imprs.is.mpg.de&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=6m89ycc3fiji_lw0be0gs-elyo5j7sfzr_6buhggly4&s=poji5jnffh9ny1wizetriyvvqz0s1bg3fcnz1mujunk&e= - all aspects of the program are in english. - you may join our program in spring 2018. - you will be mentored by our internationally renowned faculty. - you will register as a university graduate student and conduct research for approximately three years. - you can take part in a wide variety of scientific seminars, advanced training workshops, and social activities. - your doctoral degree will be conferred when you successfully complete your ph.d. project. - our dedicated coordinator will assist you throughout your time as a doctoral student. people with a strong academic background and a master?s degree in engineering, computer science, cognitive science, mathematics, control theory, neuroscience, materials science, physics, or related fields should apply. we seek to increase the number of women in areas where they are underrepresented, so we explicitly encourage women to apply. we are committed to employing more handicapped individuals and especially encourage them to apply. we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our institutions. admission will be competitive. if selected, you will receive funding via an employment contract, subject to the rules of the max planck society and the two participating universities. you can apply at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__imprs.is.mpg.de&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=6m89ycc3fiji_lw0be0gs-elyo5j7sfzr_6buhggly4&s=poji5jnffh9ny1wizetriyvvqz0s1bg3fcnz1mujunk&e= before midday cet on november 7, 2017. the selection interviews will take place between january 23 and january 26, 2018 in stuttgart and t?bingen, germany.  for further information please contact dr. leila masri at imprs at is.mpg.de or visit our website https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__imprs.is.mpg.de&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=6m89ycc3fiji_lw0be0gs-elyo5j7sfzr_6buhggly4&s=poji5jnffh9ny1wizetriyvvqz0s1bg3fcnz1mujunk&e=

subject: postdoc position in the field of  interactive machine learning at cor-lab, bielefeld university
content: for the newly started project cluster cinementas - cooperative  interaction based on mental models for assistive systems we solicit  several research positions with salary paid according to german tvl-13.  project duration is 36 months. cinementas is focused on the research question how learning by a  technical system in interaction with a human can be shaped to remain  transparent for the human user. to achieve this goal cinementas connects  machine learning approaches with concepts from cognitive science, such  as mental models. cinementas is located at the institute for cognition and robotics  (cor-lab) and embedded in the research environment of the cluster of  excellence cognitive interaction technology (citec), both at bielefeld  university, germany. project work will be in close cooperation with the  honda research institute europe (hri, located in offenbach near  frankfurt/main), which also provides the financial funding of the project. the project is consists of five subprojects affiliated with five  research groups at the faculty of technology and at the faculty of  linguistics and literary science at bielefeld university. the present  postdoc position is dedicated to cinementas subproject cognitive  corridor learning (cocolea, prof. dr. helge ritter, ag neuroinformatics). aim of cocolea is the development of innovative strategies and  algorithms that allow to? constrain interactive machine learning within  a "corridor of readability" for the human user. underlying idea is to  exploit the redundancy of the solution space for a learning task and to  benefit from cognitive science concepts, in particular mental models, to  shape learning towards maximal understandability for the human. scope of functions: research activities (85 %):  ?- development and implementation of algorithms to realize interactive  machine learning within a corridor of readability for the human user.  ?- technical realization of a prototype system within the chosen  demonstrator scenario and environment  ?- design and conduct of empirical user studies for data acquisition  and evaluation of the model/system other acticvities (15 %):  ?- reporting and collaboration with project partners, especially hri  ?- preparation of scientific publications and presentations  ?- if necessary and thematically related to the project's research  topic, supervision of bachelor/master theses and student projects applicants are required to have a qualified phd in a pertinent topic  area within the fields of machine learning or human-machine interaction,  and an excellent diploma or master degree in informatics/computer  science or in a pertinent neighbor discipline, obtained at a research  university. we expect  ?- solid practical and theoretical expertise in machine learning,  particularly in the context of interactive settings  ?- a good publication record in pertinent international conferences  and/or scientific journals  ?- excellent programming skills (c++,python,matlab),  ?- capability for interdisciplinary cooperation  ?- team orientation and a strong motivation to integrate results in the  form of implemented software components in a shared demonstrator system  ?- good command of english in writing and speaking we further appreciate a background in cognitive science concepts about  learning and mental representations and a keen interest and willingness to learn across discipline borders. work in the project will proceed in close connection with four other  cinementas projects (cf. connected advertisements) mental models for collaborative reinforcement learning (prof. dr. stefan  kopp, ag cognitive systems and social interaction) mental models of the validity of adaptive systems (prof. dr. barbara  hammer, ag?? machine learning) collaborating on learning to classify (prof. dr. david schlangen, ag  applied computer linguistics) learning of co-constructed interactive signals in joint tasks (prof. dr.  britta wrede,?? ag applied computer science) research work in the project will include temporary stays at the honda  research institute europe located in offenbach near frankfurt/main  (about 4h train distance from bielefeld) please send your application, preferably by? e-mail in a single  pdf-document no later than oct-20 2017 to: prof. dr. helge ritter secretary mrs. susanne strunk sstrunk at techfak.uni-bielefeld.de faculty of technology bielefeld university postfach 100131 33501 bielefeld questions can be directed to prof. dr. helge ritter +495211061212 helge at techfak.uni-bielefeld.de

subject: create robotics-integrated i4.0 at irp,  tu braunschweig
content: researcher in process control and software engineering in  robotics/automation the institute for robotics and process control (irp) at technische  universit?t braunschweig solicits applications for a full funded three years researcher  position/phd position to create the digital backbone of the robobtics-integrated flexible automation  system of tomorrow. the successful candidate owns a master in robotics, automation, computer  scienceor a related field. thestudent is expected to develop and pursue research in a joint project with further partners from mechanical engineeringand industry towards demonstrating advanced optimization and learning in a reference smart factory production system. required qualifications are understanding and experience in software  engineering, very good programming skills, a basic knowledge of hardware-software systems  in robotics and/or automationfirst hands-on experience with such systems. knowledge and experience in machine learningis an advantage. proficiency  in german is required. the successful candidate is intrinsically motivated and enjoys working  in an international teamtowards the phd in a highly relevant field for future manufacturing. the irp  institute provides support through a strong research environment, excellent equipment, base funding  and projects in humanoid robotics, soft robotics, human-robot interaction, artificial  intelligence and industrial applications. the technische universit?t braunschweig is one of the oldest in germany and member of the german tu9 association of leading technical universities. it is surrounded by a large number of independent research  institutes. braunschweig is a medium-sized research-oriented city with a very high  density of r&d related companies and a vivid student life. tu braunschweig is a family  friendly and equal opportunity employer, part time appointments can be negotiated. applications of women are particularly encouraged. the formal advert (in german) can be found under https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.robotik-2dbs.de_sites_default_files_irp-5fmitarb_ien_ausschreibung-5fstelle-5f02-5fa.pdf&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0nsnbbiwv9i_x93uh9wjjepxqggouvgv9u0dk6fdf6a&s=23hszzzlmxqkckreadrzwzvegqrbcxcugw9ikv1iceq&e= please send your application in a single pdf to  applications at rob.cs.tu-bs.de. informal inquiries may be sent to prof. jochen steil(jsteil at rob.tu-bs.de) all applications submitted until 23.10.2017 will receive full  consideration, review will continueuntil the position is filled.

subject: fully funded 3+3-year position at irp,  tu braunschweig

subject: postdoc position in the field of  interactive machine learning at cor-lab, bielefeld university
content: for the newly started project cluster cinementas - cooperative interaction based on mental models for assistive systems we solicit several research positions with salary paid according to german tvl-13. project duration is 36 months. cinementas is focused on the research question how learning by a technical system in interaction with a human can be shaped to remain transparent for the human user. to achieve this goal cinementas connects machine learning approaches with concepts from cognitive science, such as mental models. cinementas is located at the institute for cognition and robotics (cor-lab) and embedded in the research environment of the cluster of excellence cognitive interaction technology (citec), both at bielefeld university, germany. project work will be in close cooperation with the honda research institute europe (hri, located in offenbach near frankfurt/main), which also provides the financial funding of the project. the project is consists of five subprojects affiliated with five research groups at the faculty of technology and at the faculty of linguistics and literary science at bielefeld university. the present postdoc position is dedicated to cinementas subproject cognitive corridor learning (cocolea, prof. dr. helge ritter, ag neuroinformatics). aim of cocolea is the development of innovative strategies and algorithms that allow to  constrain interactive machine learning within a "corridor of readability" for the human user. underlying idea is to exploit the redundancy of the solution space for a learning task and to benefit from cognitive science concepts, in particular mental models, to shape learning towards maximal understandability for the human. scope of functions: research activities (85 %):  - development and implementation of algorithms to realize interactive machine learning within a corridor of readability for the human user.  - technical realization of a prototype system within the chosen demonstrator scenario and environment  - design and conduct of empirical user studies for data acquisition and evaluation of the model/system other acticvities (15 %):  - reporting and collaboration with project partners, especially hri  - preparation of scientific publications and presentations  - if necessary and thematically related to the project's research topic, supervision of bachelor/master theses and student projects applicants are required to have a qualified phd in a pertinent topic area within the fields of machine learning or human-machine interaction, and an excellent diploma or master degree in informatics/computer science or in a pertinent neighbor discipline, obtained at a research university. we expect  - solid practical and theoretical expertise in machine learning, particularly in the context of interactive settings  - a good publication record in pertinent international conferences and/or scientific journals  - excellent programming skills (c++,python,matlab),  - capability for interdisciplinary cooperation  - team orientation and a strong motivation to integrate results in the form of implemented software components in a shared demonstrator system  - good command of english in writing and speaking we further appreciate a background in cognitive science concepts about learning and mental representations and a keen interest and willingness to learn across discipline borders. work in the project will proceed in close connection with four other cinementas projects (cf. connected advertisements) mental models for collaborative reinforcement learning (prof. dr. stefan kopp, ag cognitive systems and social interaction) mental models of the validity of adaptive systems (prof. dr. barbara hammer, ag   machine learning) collaborating on learning to classify (prof. dr. david schlangen, ag applied computer linguistics) learning of co-constructed interactive signals in joint tasks (prof. dr. britta wrede,   ag applied computer science) research work in the project will include temporary stays at the honda research institute europe located in offenbach near frankfurt/main (about 4h train distance from bielefeld) please send your application, preferably by  e-mail in a single pdf-document no later than oct-15 2017 to: prof. dr. helge ritter secretary mrs. susanne strunk sstrunk at techfak.uni-bielefeld.de faculty of technology bielefeld university postfach 100131 33501 bielefeld questions can be directed to prof. dr. helge ritter +495211061212 helge at techfak.uni-bielefeld.de

subject: open position at the rank of full  professor (w3) at bielefeld university / fraunhofer
content: the faculty of technolgy at bielefeld university and the fraunhofer institute of optronics, system technologies and image exploitation (iosb) are jointly seeking to fill a position as full professor for ?cognitive automation?. the position will be granted initially for five years; candidates will receive tenure after successful evaluation. candidates will be expected to lead the department for cognitive automation technologies of the applied research center ?industrial automation?  at the fraunhofer institute of optronics, system technologies and image exploitation (iosb-ina) in lemgo. the applied research center industrial automation (iosb-ina) develops innovative hardware and software solutions in the areas of industrial internet, intelligent automation and system usability. core competences include the interconnection, analysis, monitoring as well as the user-centered design of cyperphysical systems. candidates will have a strong international and thematically broad track record in the areas of intelligent and cognitive systems, robotics and/or automation. they are expected to contribute to the undergraduate and graduate curricula at the faculty of technology and to cooperate with other groups at the department, in particular with the cognitive interaction technology excellence center (citec). candidates are expected to perform research and develop new methods, software architectures and algorithms in the areas of cognitive systems and robotics with the goal of supporting the development of more flexible, robust, intelligent, interconnected and easily reconfigurable adaptive manufacturing processes as well as to support their monitoring and optimization. successful candidates will be expected to develop a portfolio comprising as many of the following areas as possible: ?      machine learning for automation (e.g. process mining, predictive maintenance, problem diagnosis) ?      self-configuring systems in manufacturing ?      integration of autonomous cognitive systems (e.g. robots) intro manufacturing processes ?      security and robustness of cognitive systems in manufacturing ?      cognitive systems for the control and monitoring of complex assembly lines ?      intelligent interconnection, synchronization and monitoring of heterogeneous and geographically distributed manufacturing processes ?      cognitive systems for the optimization of resources in manufacturing ?      software architectures for cognitive systems that support adaptive and reconfigurable manufacturing processes the ability to contribute to the above research areas should be demonstrated by a corresponding publication record. we expect experience in the coordination of scientific projects, in particular collaborative projects as well as the demonstrated ability to acquire third party funding. experience in working on projects with industry partners is desired. formal requirements for the position include graduate studies at an higher education center, an excellent phd degree as well as pedagogical suitability. additional scientific qualifications obtained after the phd, acquired, e.g. as part of a habilitation or postdoctoral period, are required. both bielefeld university and fraunhofer are equal opportunity employers. they strive for increasing the number of female professors and are committed to ensuring a family-friendly working environment, offering flexible working hours and services that support work (family) life balance. we especially welcome applications from qualified female researchers. applications from candidates with special needs will be given preference in case of ties with other candidates. the following documents should be sent as part of the application:   ?      curriculum vitae ?      certificates and degrees ?      complete publication list with an indication of which are considered as the most important publications ?      description of scientific achievements ?      teaching and research statement the applications should be sent to both the dean of the faculty of technology of bielefeld university, prof. dr. philipp cimiano at dekan at techfak.uni-bielefeld.de, as well as to the director of the fraunhofer iosb at the following address: director oft he  fraunhofer iosb prof. dr.-ing. habil. j?rgen beyerer fraunhoferstra?e 1 76131 karlsruhe --  -- prof. dr. philipp cimiano ag semantic computing exzellenzcluster f?r cognitive interaction technology (citec) universit?t bielefeld tel: +49 521 106 12249 fax: +49 521 106 6560 mail: cimiano at cit-ec.uni-bielefeld.de office citec-2.307 universit?tsstr. 21-25 33615 bielefeld, nrw germany

subject: max planck postdoctoral fellowship for  excellent women in computer science in-reply-to: <42100a15-c1b4-0faf-6779-366f3703281d@mpi-inf.mpg.de> references: <42100a15-c1b4-0faf-6779-366f3703281d@mpi-inf.mpg.de>
content: max planck postdoctoral fellowship for excellent women in computer science every second year the max planck institute for informatics awards the  lise meitner award fellowship. this postdoctoral grant supports  excellent female computer scientists in their careers, giving them the  opportunity to develop their scientific ideas without exertion of  influence. it consists of a two-year tax-free research fellowship and  business expenses. fellows will be chosen based on the strength of their academic  background and research credentials. applications should include a cv,  cover letter, publication list, short research plan (one page is  enough), and two references. this grant is according to the fellowship  rules of the max planck society; it usually amounts to 3,000 euro/month  and is completed by compensation for business expenses of 10,000  euro/year. the deadline for the application is 01.12.2017. for more information, please contact meitner-award at mpi-inf.mpg.de. if  you are interested in department 2: computer vision and multimodal  computing, you can also contact dr. qianru sun (qsun at mpi-inf.mpg.de)  more directly. about the max planck institute for informatics the max planck society is germany's largest society for fundamental  research with more than 30 nobel prize winners, including prof.  christiane n?sslein-volhard - one of the few female nobel laureates. the  research institutes of the max planck society are nationally and  internationally renowned as centers of excellence in foundational research. the max planck institute (mpi) for lnformatics is devoted to  cutting-edge research in computer science and technology with a focus on  algorithms and their applications in a broad sense. its research ranges  from fundamental topics (algorithms and complexity, automation of logic)  to a variety of application domains (computer graphics and vision,  geometric computation, program verification, databases and information  systems, and computational biology). the mpi for lnformatics is located  on the campus of saarland university in saarbr?cken, germany. the saarland university campus is also home to the max planck institute  for software systems, the german research institute for artificial  intelligence, the center for it-security, privacy, and accountabilty  (cispa), the cluster of excellence on multimodal computing and  interaction, the center for bioinformatics, and the graduate school of  computer science. these institutions cooperate closely and comprise a  total of more than 300 researchers in computer science. the institute  collaborates with several of the major research institutions in europe  and the united states and has high international visibility. the mpi for lnformatics strives to provide a family-friendly work  environment, with day care opportunities for smaller children and other  means of support for working mothers.

subject: multiple phd positions in human-machine  interaction funded by the animatas innovative training network
content: call for multiple phd positions in human-machine interaction funded by animatas innovative training network  animatas (msca ? itn ? 2017 - 765955 2) is a h2020 marie sklodowska curie european training network funded by horizon 2020 (the european union?s framework programme for research and innovation), coordinated by universit? pierre et marie curie (paris, france).  animatas partners are: upmc (coord.), uppsala univ., institut mines telecom, kth, epfl, inesc-id, jacobs univ. and softbank robotics europe. scientific and technical objectives animatas focuses on the following objectives: 1) exploration of fundamental questions relating to the interconnections between robots and virtual characters? appearance, behaviours and perception by people 2) development of new social learning mechanisms that can deal with different types of human intervention and allow robots and virtual characters to learn in an unconstrained manner  3) development of new approaches for robots and virtual characters? personalised adaptation to human users in unstructured and dynamically evolving social interactions  multiple positions in human-machine interaction:  15 early-stage researchers (esr) positions of 36 months are available within animatas. the successful candidates will participate in the network?s training activities offered by the european academic and industrial participating teams. the successful candidate will be have the opportunity to work with interactive robotics, furhat robotics, mobsya, university of wisconsin- madison,  university of southern california, immersion sas, idmind, trinity college dublin.  details and specific deadlines are available at ginevra.castellano at it.uu.se esr 4 -  synthesis of multi-modal socially intelligent human-robot interaction contact: amir pandey (sbr) akpandey at softbankrobotics.com esr 5 - socially compliant epfl.ch esr 9 - learning from and about humans for robot task learning contact: mohamed chetouani (upmc) mohamed.chetouani at upmc.fr  esr 10 - let?s learn by collaborating with robots contact: subject: robotics faculty position at new york  university
content: dear colleagues, new york university invites applications for faculty positions (all ranks) in all areas of robotics as part of a multi-year growth initiative of the tandon school of engineering (joint search between ece and mae). the deadline for full consideration is january 15th 2018. (cf. official advertisement below). feel free to contact me if you have any questions. ------------------ new york university has multiple open tenured/tenure-track faculty positions in robotics at its tandon school of engineering in the departments of electrical and computer engineering (ece) and mechanical and aerospace engineering (mae) as part of a major multi-year growth initiative in robotics. we seek applicants with outstanding research achievements and future promise in all areas of robotics, including, but not limited to, learning and perception for robotics, bio-inspired robotics, robotics for healthcare, autonomous vehicles, and soft robotics. candidates must have a phd degree in an engineering or related discipline, show evidence of the ability to pursue an independent and ambitious research program and a strong commitment to teaching. ? the nyu tandon school of engineering strongly supports interdisciplinary research and has close collaborations with the langone school of medicine, the courant institute of mathematical sciences, nyu abu dhabi, and nyu shanghai. the faculty and students of the nyu tandon school of engineering are at the forefront of the high-tech start-up culture in new york city, and have access to and engage strongly with the school?s world-class research centers in cyber security (ccs.nyu.edu), wireless communications (nyuwireless.com), smart transportation, augmented and virtual reality, and ai and have access to a state-of-the-art makerspace. candidates should include a cover letter, curriculum vitae, research and teaching statements, and letters from at least three references. all application materials should be submitted electronically via https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__apply.interfolio.com_46118&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=zslgjuovc02zqnf1akfkq8tei3xpchiu7n1dkruyoqw&s=9nzgfzmmt7iprdyorrciuqhijjb1kffpgmxykyauciq&e=. applications received by january 15, 2018 will receive full consideration. new york university is an equal opportunity employer. new york university is committed to a policy of equal treatment and opportunity in every aspect of its hiring and promotion process without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, pregnancy or childbirth (or related medical condition), sexual orientation, partnership status, gender and/or gender identity or expression, marital, parental or familial status, caregiver status, national origin, ethnicity, alienage or citizenship status, veteran or military status, age, disability, predisposing genetic characteristics, domestic violence victim status, unemployment status, or any other legally protected basis. women, racial and ethnic minorities, persons of minority sexual orientation or gender identity, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply for vacant positions at all levels. ------------------------------------------------ ? ludovic righetti ? associate professor ? tandon school of engineering, new york university ? department of electrical and computer engineering ? department of mechanical and aerospace engineering ? ? independent research group leader ? max-planck institute for intelligent systems, germany ? subject: 3-year funded phd position in legged  robot locomotion, dlg mpi-is, germany
content: we offer: a 3-year funded phd position conducting research on dynamically running, legged robots. we are looking for research-enthusiastic candidates, with background in applied mechatronics, and related disciplines. place: dynamic locomotion group, max planck institute for intelligent systems (mpi-is, campus stuttgart), germany more information: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__dlg.is.mpg.de_jobs_mechatronic-2ddesign-2ddevelopment-2dand-2dcharacterization-2dof-2delectromagnetically-2dactuated-2dlegged-2drobots&d=dwidaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=p91qkefwwewawipz94ngk5pofxgvhkoln_us-yvejbo&s=c55tdvor_se4lvvz8utdtkq2kya9u7zspvph8uh7sii&e= https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__dlg.is.mpg.de_jobs&d=dwidaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=p91qkefwwewawipz94ngk5pofxgvhkoln_us-yvejbo&s=bv1xzn_-s3zl6n1q-f_p20btxaa0shvrtff3n2rniqi&e= with kind regards, alexander spr??witz -- alexander spr??witz, dr. sc. max planck research group leader dynamic locomotion group max planck institute for intelligent systems heisenbergstr. 3 70569 stuttgart, germany web: dlg.is.mpg.de

subject: help us bring mobile picking robots  into warehouses!
content: we are a robotics startup located in munich, germany, and develop the  next generation of perception-driven logistics robots that can navigate  through warehouses and pick items from the shelves. our robots are  deployed in several warehouses and solve real customer problems in live  operation. with over 75 employees, we are one of the biggest advanced  robotics teams in europe. but we still offer 100% start-up atmosphere,  combined with high responsibility in your daily tasks, and great benefits. to take the next step towards fleets of intelligent picking robots, we  are looking for several new colleagues to join our team in the next  months. if you are enthusiastic about robots and have a bachelor,  master, or phd in robotics, cs, or similar studies, please consider the  following openings: * robot deployment engineer (m/f) * software qa and testing engineer (m/f) * al research engineer (m/f) * al software architect (m/f) * cloud devops engineer (m/f) * multi-robot coordination specialist (m/f) * robot ux and frontend developer (m/f) detailed information on these openings can be found at  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.magazino.eu_jobs&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ifg-w83aetl9jvyt7c11h1dxhffwyyg35gmlvq3rsks&s=bufuvcd6xxlg5wxqjbqcoah23opcanqwrbbdjffop9w&e= if you are interested, please send your cv to jobs at magazino.eu  <mailto:jobs at magazino.eu> looking forward to talking to you! moritz --  dr. moritz tenorth cto magazino gmbh landsberger str. 234 80687 m?nchen t +49-89-21552415-8 f +49-89-21552415-9 m +49-170-543 1717 tenorth at magazino.eu www.magazino.eu amtsgericht m?nchen hrb 209758 ust-idnr.: de293308625 gesch?ftsf?hrer: frederik brantner, lukas zanger

subject: full professorship "agricultural  engineering and robotics" at the university of bonn, germany
content: the university of bonn invites applications for a full professorship (w3) ?agricultural  engineering and robotics"  to be appointed at the earliest time possible. the professorship will strengthen the cluster of excellence initiative phenorob  (www.phenorob.de), especially the link between the existing competencies in sensing,  perception, and robotics and the application of those techniques in crop science. the professorship represents the above-mentioned field in research and university-level  teaching. we are seeking an individual who has achieved international recognition in  one of the following fields: - autonomous intelligent agricultural machinery - innovative technologies for tillage, seeding, crop management and harvesting - digital process control teaching activities are expected in agricultural engineering, sensors and technology as  well as robotics in the study programs of the faculty of agriculture. acquisition of extramural funding and the coordination of research networks are expected. candidates have to comply with the general prerequisites acc. to ? 36 of the university  law (hochschulgesetz) of the federal state of northrhine-westfalia. the university is an  equal opportunities employer. preference will be given to handicapped people, all other  considerations being equal. applications in german or english language accompanied by supporting documentation  (letter of interest, cv, certificates, credentials, list of publications, teaching activities, and  a short statement of research strategies) should be submitted by march 2nd 2018 in  electronic form to the dean of the faculty of agriculture rheinische friedrich-wilhelms-universit?t bonn  meckenheimer allee 174 53115 bonn dekan at lwf.uni-bonn.de

subject: phd position in lifelong visual slam -  bosch corporate research and university of zaragoza
content: ----------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------ 1 phd position available - lifelong visual slam ------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------ we have an unique opportunity to pursue doctoral research on visual slam, a relevant topic of academic and industrial interest; and acquire an excellent academic and industrial background from top actors in the field. the focus will be lifelong visual slam, with the aim of developing scene models that integrate the dynamics of typical scenarios, from visual data. the phd will be developed - partly in the slamlab (university of zaragoza,  spain ), pioneers and recognized experts in slam, authors of several of the most relevant slam papers, under my supervision - and partly in bosch corporate research (hildesheim, germany), in one of the biggest and most active computer vision groups in the european industrial sector. please, see more information and apply in the following link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.bosch-2dcareer.de_en_bewerben_jobsearch_-2d_cui_job_&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=g4maxtz_olz05ih1defevu_xtsqpguo3iu9ouos969m&s=mtvfivzt5r6q2pxinei2un4mbktzz_vzgtrubdlearg&e= zrb_unreg_search/en/567d863a01021ed7b58752dffc2c4786 ------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------ phd topic summary ------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------ visual slam (simultaneous localization and mapping) is one of the key technologies for robotics, autonomous driving, augmented- and virtual-reality. visual slam takes the images from a camera mounted on a moving platform, with the aim of estimating its ego-motion and a scene map from the video sequence. lifelong slam refers to the development of map models that capture long-term dynamics of the objects in natural scenes (e.g., changes in position of books on a desk, doors closing and opening, chairs that are moved). most of the current visual slam algorithms assume a rigid scene and cannot model such changes, limiting the temporal validity of the maps. thus, the core topic of the phd constitutes of the incorporation of such dynamic patterns to slam maps, which is one of the less explored research problems in the field. ------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------ job description ------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------ * research in the field of lifelong visual slam * develop and evaluate novel algorithms for visual slam * develop efficient computer vision algorithms and software * analysis of research community, cooperate with and contribute to the research in the host labs * publish scientific articles with the developed algorithms and results * attend scientific conferences and events to present your research results * prepare a doctoral thesis related with the research project ------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------ requirements ------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------ * very good master degree(s) in engineering, physics, robotics, computer science or a related field, with a solid background in machine learning and/or computer vision * excellent academic background * high personal initiative, independent and structured way of working * demonstrable programming skills, preferably c/c++, matlab and/or python * demonstrable practical experience and knowledge in machine learning, computer vision and/or visual slam * convincing appearance, high commitment combined with interpersonal skills in teams * fluent english, written and spoken, knowledge of academic english * german knowledge is an advantage --  javier civera jcivera[at]unizar[dot]es https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__webdiis.unizar.es_-7ejcivera&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=g4maxtz_olz05ih1defevu_xtsqpguo3iu9ouos969m&s=dt0s8cnesoq-y3xawa5ge6iy0uwsunjazf25og3ms-0&e= subject: robotics faculty position at new york  university in-reply-to: <7eda75fd-06b0-8704-3291-699b2103aa33@nyu.edu> references: <7eda75fd-06b0-8704-3291-699b2103aa33@nyu.edu>
content: dear colleagues, this is a reminder that the deadline for application to the nyu faculty position in robotics is january 15th (cf. details below). feel free to contact me if you have any questions about the position. best regards ludovic ------------------ new york university has multiple open tenured/tenure-track faculty positions in robotics at its tandon school of engineering in the departments of electrical and computer engineering (ece) and mechanical and aerospace engineering (mae) as part of a major multi-year growth initiative in robotics. we seek applicants with outstanding research achievements and future promise in all areas of robotics, including, but not limited to, learning and perception for robotics, bio-inspired robotics, robotics for healthcare, autonomous vehicles, and soft robotics. candidates must have a phd degree in an engineering or related discipline, show evidence of the ability to pursue an independent and ambitious research program and a strong commitment to teaching. the nyu tandon school of engineering strongly supports interdisciplinary research and has close collaborations with the langone school of medicine, the courant institute of mathematical sciences, nyu abu dhabi, and nyu shanghai. the faculty and students of the nyu tandon school of engineering are at the forefront of the high-tech start-up culture in new york city, and have access to and engage strongly with the school?s world-class research centers in cyber security (ccs.nyu.edu), wireless communications (nyuwireless.com), smart transportation, augmented and virtual reality, and ai and have access to a state-of-the-art makerspace. candidates should include a cover letter, curriculum vitae, research and teaching statements, and letters from at least three references. all application materials should be submitted electronically via https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__apply.interfolio.com_46118&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lnraq5kc2prdhfulgvoniwv3-blgtrj3uhl8mkgo7nc&s=jjddgrge7bqpwmkuasaesg77kbhkruet8lau2nz0nsw&e=. applications received by january 15, 2018 will receive full consideration. new york university is an equal opportunity employer. new york university is committed to a policy of equal treatment and opportunity in every aspect of its hiring and promotion process without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, pregnancy or childbirth (or related medical condition), sexual orientation, partnership status, gender and/or gender identity or expression, marital, parental or familial status, caregiver status, national origin, ethnicity, alienage or citizenship status, veteran or military status, age, disability, predisposing genetic characteristics, domestic violence victim status, unemployment status, or any other legally protected basis. women, racial and ethnic minorities, persons of minority sexual orientation or gender identity, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply for vacant positions at all levels. subject: research engineer in humanoid  tele-operation, in inria, france
content: *************** full job description here:   https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__jobs.inria.fr_public_classic_en_offres_2017-2d00205&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tzvd8nqoe_xaawjfnjuuqtrgkzcpjz2xabntxajnqis&s=wct1cjtevkelmx1nfdl10v_qwobzynfdq1nke-qgtxc&e= *************** we are looking for a research engineer to join the team larsen in inria (nancy, france). the engineer will join the team working in the european project andy (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__andy-2dproject.eu_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tzvd8nqoe_xaawjfnjuuqtrgkzcpjz2xabntxajnqis&s=cvljj6f92oua1giq0rday07j8urfd-6i3tbzcdc7lgq&e=) <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__andy-2dproject.eu_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tzvd8nqoe_xaawjfnjuuqtrgkzcpjz2xabntxajnqis&s=cvljj6f92oua1giq0rday07j8urfd-6i3tbzcdc7lgq&e=)>, a h2020 funded project with several international partners in germany (dlr),  slovenia  (jsi) and italy (iit).  one of the objectives of the project is to realize collaborative scenarios between the humanoid robot icub and a human partner, equipped with several wearable sensors. collaboration is intended as anticipatory physical interaction that assists the human partner in realizing a task while optimizing some criteria (equilibrium, effort, ergonomy). for example, we need to realize a collaborative assembly or pick & place task, where the icub and the human partner pick an object together, transport it (eventually) to a desired location, and then place it, to make some assembly.  in this context, we would like to implement an immersive whole-body tele-operation of the icub, so that a human operator can control in real-time the humanoid icub, to provide demonstrations of the desired robot behavior during these tasks. the human operator will be equipped with a xsens mvn suit, a wearable system for motion capture, a virtual-reality system with joysticks (e.g., htc vive), sensorized gloves and shoes. in the team we proposed preliminary theoretical model for offline synthesis of the robot's movement from xsens data, and we already have a working kinematics retargeting implementation online. the goal of the engineer will be to retarget the movement and actions of the human operator into the robot icub, in real-time, ensuring the safety and stability of the robot motion. requirements: ms or phd in software engineering or robotics and/or experience in collaborative software development excellent teamwork and experience in collaborative software development (agile, ...) excellent knowledge of robotics expertise in programming development and software architecture previous experience in collaborative projects, real robots or tele-operation is a plus the position is for 1 year, extensions are possible. salary depends on experience. to apply: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__jobs.inria.fr_public_classic_en_offres_2017-2d00205&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tzvd8nqoe_xaawjfnjuuqtrgkzcpjz2xabntxajnqis&s=wct1cjtevkelmx1nfdl10v_qwobzynfdq1nke-qgtxc&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__jobs.inria.fr_public_classic_en_offres_2017-2d00205&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tzvd8nqoe_xaawjfnjuuqtrgkzcpjz2xabntxajnqis&s=wct1cjtevkelmx1nfdl10v_qwobzynfdq1nke-qgtxc&e=> candidates are also expected to contact via e-mail serena ivaldi, serena.ivaldi at inria.fr --------- serena ivaldi team larsen inria nancy grand-est room c104 tel: (+33) 03-5495-8475 mail: serena.ivaldi at inria.fr web: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__members.loria.fr_sivaldi_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tzvd8nqoe_xaawjfnjuuqtrgkzcpjz2xabntxajnqis&s=em5umspdndxe5luqnkutnpdfiary2ru4-oufilvuyra&e= subject: phd/postdoc position at hamburg  university in robot vision/computer vision in-reply-to: <bbdb09af-accd-bd18-f7e2-cab3651fc5e3@informatik.uni-hamburg.de> references: <bbdb09af-accd-bd18-f7e2-cab3651fc5e3@informatik.uni-hamburg.de>
content: phd/postdoc position at hamburg university in robot vision/computer  vision (application deadline: jan. 14th!) a phd or postdoc position is open in the computer vision group at the  computer science department of the university of hamburg (uhh), germany,  headed by simone frintrop (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.inf.uni-2dhamburg.de_en_inst_ab_cv_people_frintrop.html&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=-cpmh5fyclhtv2f-ui66hbzxfwgy0zmu-w2uykcq3s8&s=r3xapm-dbohqtm36yijucdtrmby0yjcxwrabkfd1v80&e= ) the group: -------------- the focus of the computer vision group at uhh is to develop algorithms  in the context of mobile vision devices such as autonomous robots or  head-mounted camera systems. in our research, we seek inspiration from  the human visual system and develop algorithms inspired by these  mechanisms for solving computer vision tasks. main topics of research  are visual attention, saliency prediction, segmentation, and object  discovery. find out more about our group here:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.inf.uni-2dhamburg.de_en_inst_ab_cv.html&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=-cpmh5fyclhtv2f-ui66hbzxfwgy0zmu-w2uykcq3s8&s=sn3k9ehu3ypeq5z5bo5y93mxup3xbdx0ppcsmwr8m5w&e= the project: --------------- you will work within the new research project "adaptive cross-modal  sensor data acquisition", which is a cooperation between the university  of hamburg (uhh, groups of prof. dr. gerkmann and prof. dr. frintrop)  and the technical university of hamburg (tuhh, groups of prof. dr. knopp  and prof. dr. schlaefer). a goal of the project is to develop algorithms  to analyze images and other sensor information obtained from mobile  robots or medical measuring devices in order to determine the parts  which are most promising for further analysis. this enables to  prioritize the data processing in order to efficiently utilize computing  and time resources.the research in our group will focus on the computer  vision aspects of the project, involving saliency detection, the  combination of vision data with other modalities such as audio or  medical data, probabilistic approaches for active vision, and deep  learning approaches in computer vision. pre-knowledge in one or several  of these areas is an advantage but can also be obtained on the job.  ?your profile: ---------------- you should have a university degree in an appropriate area such as  computer science, engineering, physics, or mathematics and you should  have experience with image processing/computer vision. knowledge of  machine learning, especially deep learning, is helpful. you should have good programming skills, preferably in python, c++, or  matlab. knowledge of the image processing library opencv and of deep  learning libraries such as tensorflow or caffe is helpful. good knowledge of english (spoken and written) and good communication  skills are essential, knowledge of the german language or the  willingness to learn german will help you to enjoy your stay better. if  you are also curious, motivated, and communicative, willing to  continuously learn and improve your skills, you are a perfect candidate  to join our team.  ?our offer: ------------ - 3 year full-time position (part-time work is possible (but at least 50%)) - payment according to the german public service scale tv-l 13- the  opportunity to work on interesting state-of-the-art research topics  according to international standards together with experienced researchers - a pleasant working environment and a great team - a lot of room for your own ideas - starting date: as soon as possible  ?location: ------------ hamburg, the second largest city in germany, is one of the most livable  cities in the world  (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.thelocal.de_20170816_hamburg-2drated-2d10th-2dmost-2dliveable-2dcity-2din-2dthe-2dworld-2dreport&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=-cpmh5fyclhtv2f-ui66hbzxfwgy0zmu-w2uykcq3s8&s=kzfwevm-bbeamffe5bno2cltzfrkamkzhtlxjivgxvm&e=).  it has a beach right in the city, a famous harbor, many green recreation  areas, more bridges than venice and amsterdam together, and a nightlife  that?s among europe?s best. the university of hamburg (uhh) is the  largest university in northern germany and frequently cited ranking  systems place it among the top 1% of global universities. the city of  hamburg is currently investing 23m euro for expanding the computer  science departments in hamburg within the platform ahoi.digital which  also funds the here announced project. the university aims to increase the number of women in research and  teaching and explicitly encourages women to apply. equally qualified  female applicants will receive preference in accordance with the hamburg  equality act (hamburgisches gleichstellungsgesetz, hmbgleig). severely disabled applicants will receive preference over equally  qualified non-disabled applicants. please send your electronic application in a single pdf document  (including a detailed cv, a certificate of your latest degree including  grades, a pdf of your master thesis (postdocs: phd thesis), and if you  have already published research articles: your publication list and a  pdf of your best article) to kerstin diop:  diop at informatik.uni-hamburg.de <mailto:diop at informatik.uni-hamburg.de>.  the subject in the email shall start with "application". the closing  date for applications is january 14th, 2018. best regards, simone frintrop (professor for computer vision at uhh)

subject: fatikow_offis-univ.oldenburg_researcher  position open

subject: a happy new year from magazino -- we  are hiring!
content: dear robot-enthusiasts, our team from magazino wishes you a happy new year 2018! we are a robotics startup located in munich, germany, and develop the  next generation of perception-driven logistics robots that can navigate  through warehouses and pick items from the shelves. our robots are  deployed in several warehouses and solve real customer problems in live  operation. with over 82 employees, we are one of the biggest advanced  robotics teams in europe. but we still offer 100% start-up atmosphere,  combined with high responsibility in your daily tasks, and great benefits. as we have big targets for 2018, we need the right people to achieve  them. if you are enthusiastic about robots and have a bachelor, master,  or phd in robotics, cs, or similar studies, please consider the  following openings:   * robot deployment engineer (m/f)   * software architect python (m/f)   * robot qa and testing engineer (m/f)   * robot software enthusiast (m/f)   * robot ui and frontend developer (m/f)   * senior navigation engineer (m/f)   * software developer c ++/ python detailed information on these openings can be found at  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.magazino.eu_jobs&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=jwlpsunuiilbxb1pn9wsm5hi2sfuwlgc8m9nxdu2vue&s=vemazs_x8j4762wfxmdbpumuvwqrtkkdbwcf3yvnfng&e= if you are interested, please send your cv to jobs at magazino.eu looking forward to talking to you! moritz --  dr. moritz tenorth cto magazino gmbh landsberger str. 234 80687 m?nchen t +49-89-21552415-8 f +49-89-21552415-9 m +49-170-543 1717 tenorth at magazino.eu www.magazino.eu amtsgericht m?nchen hrb 209758 ust-idnr.: de293308625 gesch?ftsf?hrer: frederik brantner, lukas zanger

subject: postdoctoral in physical hri /  perception at tu berlin, germany
content: the research group mti-engage at tu berlin, germany is taking  applications for a *2-year postdoctoral* research position in physical  human-robot interaction. the scientific task within the group is to*develop robot perception*  methods for *continuous sensor information*, especially using nonverbal  cues such as gestures, body motions, and contact forces. possible  research questions include: - how well can the progress of an interaction be detected from body motion? - which perceptual features and methods are helpful to continuously  synchronize robot motion with human motion? - when should robots emphasize legibility of their motions over efficiency? - which social cues do human lay persons give robots before, during, and  after object handover? - how can a robot detect whether or not its interaction goals are shared  by their interaction partner? successful candidates will have the chance to work in a fully equipped  robotics lab, will be supported in their efforts by team members and  student assistants working on a joint robot system, and will see their  work used for experiments in an interdisiciplinary context.? the lab's  infrastructure includes modern, force-controllable robot arms  (franka-emika panda), two humanoid robots (pepper and nao), marker-based  and marker-less motion capture systems, and rapid prototyping tools. we are particularly interested in candidates with experience in  programming (e.g. python, c++) and robot system integration (e.g. ros).  knowledge of probabilistic/bayesian approaches and dynamical systems is  highly welcome. the position is fully funded (level tvl-e14 100%,  3.832eur/month) until october 2019 and can be filled immediately. we  explicitly encourage female candidates to apply and will prefer them for  comparably strong applications. link to official job offer: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__stellenticket.de_45606_-3flang-3den&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=jwymrmp_zhqsfozrfdwwoyqecea5kvkwkf6gr139nro&s=84nqqn41ljk_fyme6xljdhpmfibqfbo0c2w6vssezk0&e= link to additional information: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.mti-2dengage.tu-2dberlin.de_research_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=jwymrmp_zhqsfozrfdwwoyqecea5kvkwkf6gr139nro&s=edhgjryjpeaftek0cwpansry4ucfh_rkkfnqfrag0gu&e= (german) https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.user.tu-2dberlin.de_raphael.deimel_researchprofile.html&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=jwymrmp_zhqsfozrfdwwoyqecea5kvkwkf6gr139nro&s=5nuffbwnwpnirjm482w06o6bxfc__rbpl9pd_x6-evm&e= subject: assistant professorship for medical  robotics - karlsruhe institute of technology (kit)
content: assistant professorship (w1, non-tenure track) for medical robotics at karlsruhe institute of technology (kit) ----- job opening ----- karlsruhe institute of technology (kit) - the research university in the helmholtz association creates and imparts knowledge for the society and the environment. it is our goal to make significant contributions to mastering the global challenges of mankind in the fields of energy, mobility, and information. for this, about 9300 employees of kit cooperate in a broad range of disciplines in research, academic education, and innovation. the institute of anthropomatics and robotics within the division 2 - informatics, economics, and society - is seeking to fill, as soon as possible, the position of a    assistant professor for medical robotics    (w1, non-tenure track). the successful candidate is expected to be highly qualified and internationally well-established persons with research experience in innovative hardware and software concepts for medical robotics. required qualifications include evidence of the ability to establish and pursue a program of high quality research in one or more of the following areas: - robot-assisted interventions, - human-robot collaboration in operating rooms, - machine learning in medical robotics, - software and control systems for medical robots and systems, and - reliability analysis and certification in medical robotics. kit significantly increases its activities in robotics and artificial intelligence; candidates are strongly encouraged to engage with national and international partners from industry and academia to initiate new research projects and collaborations. the successful candidate will be given the opportunity for graduate and undergraduate teaching in the own research domain, as well as to gain experience in the field of basic lectures at the kit department of informatics. the professorship will be part of the institute for anthropomatics and robotics. the candidate?s lab is already well-equipped with state-of-the-art robots, optical sensor systems, haptic devices, medical models, and experimental surgery setups. german language skills are not required but will simplify everyday life. support for acquiring german language skills is provided. to be able to give basic lectures, german language skills are required. outstanding scientific achievements are expected, e. g. in the context of an excellent doctorate in computer science/informatics and didactic aptitude. section 51 lhg baden-w?rttemberg applies. employment will initially be offered for four years. after a positive evaluation, employment can be extended by two additional years. the evaluation criteria for this assistant professor (non-tenure track) are according to the "qualit?tssicherungskonzept f?r juniorprofessuren mit tenure-track am karlsruher institut f?r technologie". accompanying offers are available at kit for further academic career development. kit is pursuing a gender equality policy and encourages women to apply. furthermore, in case of equal qualification preference is given to applicants with disabilities. submit applications including cv, list of publications, credentials, and a perspective statement of not more than two pages by april 3rd, 2018 to the following address:  dean, kit-department of informatics karlsruhe institute of technology am fasanengarten 5 76131 karlsruhe germany e-mail: dekanat at informatik.kit.edu for additional information contact prof. torsten kroeger, tel.: +49 721 608 43898, e-mail: torsten.kroeger at kit.edu.
