subject: openings in underwater robotics at  kraken robotik gmbh
content: kraken robotik gmbh (krg), located in bremen, germany is the recently founded fully owned german subsidiary of the canadian company kraken robotics inc. the focus of krg is the development and commercialisation of new technologies in the area of underwater robot autonomy and underwater vision systems. as of now krg has open positions for engineers with interest and/or experience in underwater robotics. anyone interested working with a new team in the interesting area of underwater systems, please send your application, including a cv and a letter of motivation to:  info at krakenrobotik.de the team of krg in bremen is looking forward for to welcome new members! ################################################################# under water robot autonomy engineer (f/m) we are searching for an engineer (m/f) to be part of the team developing control systems, autonomy functions, navigation systems and pattern recognition systems for autonomous underwater robots.  together with our canadian mother, kraken robotik gmbh in germany  has entered the market of underwater inspection systems with focus on offshore oil and gas as well as offshore wind. we are currently expanding our team in the area of autonomous control. we aim to industrialise the current state of the art in research on autonomous control, decision making, obstacle avoidance and map building for the usage in underwater robotic systems. primary focus of work of the applicant in the next three years will be on the autonomy control and navigation systems for a deep-sea crawler within in a project funded by the european union. we are looking for people that... ...bring a strong interest in programming of autonomous mobile robots ...are interested in new concepts for navigation and pattern recognition ...creating autonomy algorithms for robots in real working environments  ...are ready to help with mechatronic integration, from unscrewing screws to soldering connectors ...look forward spending time on vessels out on the water for real word trials education & experience: - master level degree from a college or university in engineering (mechanical/electrical/control/software) - preferable more than one year working experience skills in more than one of the following areas: - strong programming skills in c/c++, ruby, python, bash - kalman and bayes filtering - slam algorithms - mobile robot control system - working with open source communities - basic linux system administration - basic knowledge in electronics and mechanics primary working location for this job offer is the kraken robotik office in bremen, germany. but it is to be expected, that the applicant regularly spend longer peridos of time at our mother companies office  in st. john's, nl, canada. ################################################################# software engineer underwater vision (f/m) as a software engineer at kraken robotik gmbh, you will be involved and help lead the development of algorithms performing realtime 3d reconstructions and understanding of underwater scenes using state of the art sensing technologies. you will be responsible for implementing, improving and testing algorithm on hardware prototypes in the area of but not limited to machine vision and artificial intelligence. your approach and attention to detail will help the company to deliver disruptive technologies to the underwater market improving the cost effectiveness of underwater search and rescue mission as well as inspection campaigns. basic qualifications: ? degree in software engineering or related field ? proven experience writing code in c/c++, on a unix/linux platform ? experience in one or more of these areas: cameras, sensors and associated algorithm development ? good english language skills preferred qualifications: ? masters in computer science or related field with 3 years experience ? experience using qt, qml, opencv, boost, std, cuda, opencl ? experience with ruby, python, java script, rust or go ? experience with rtos and debugging electrical issues ? working with open source communities responsibilities and duties: ? help lead the development of state of the art sensing algorithm. ? implement c/c++ code running within a linux stack including documenting and testing code that meets the architecture requirements ? debug existing c/c++ code, find root causes and resolve software issues ? regression testing of distributed software stacks on large data sets ? work with new technologies that are vital to product development ? successfully collaborate with both software and hardware product teams ################################################################# --  dr. jan christian albiez director of engineering kraken robotik gmbh   fon: +49-(0)421 40894664 fax: +49-(0)421 40894669 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.krakenrobotik.de&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hqgqdwbpfq_h8hg4lgmvqvyrporjaqxt0i_waa_heyi&s=aszbww6pejxrfokt6keum4jptna3vourvno_2wktv0i&e=   register: district court bremen hrb 32040 managing directors: dr. jakob schwendner, greg reid

subject: where are those git gurus?
content: dear roboticist, the department "robot and assistive systems" at fraunhofer ipa among others is concerned with the development of service robots for a variety of application areas: from transport systems over mobile handling and inspection robots for industry to personal robots supporting and accompanying humans in their daily life. we closely interact with industry in order to transfer innovative robotics technologies and applications to new products and solutions. there are numerous software repositories available (see https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__github.com_ipa320&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=y--ing87i8bjbx31rh0fpphflm2jsak_2dmdnjswx2g&s=3_vcoc6hfj3zddczool7lpbdtbwws9nppvwj8yfog94&e=) that are based on the open source robot operating system ros. these repositories implement the technologies and application scenarios used on different robots such as care-o-bot (www.care-o-bot.de/en<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.care-2do-2dbot.de_en&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=y--ing87i8bjbx31rh0fpphflm2jsak_2dmdnjswx2g&s=mj6bfqzczos3mab3pacnoktmzmrkbwi35y06uhqi2-i&e=> ) or rob at work (www.rob-at-work.de/en<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.rob-2dat-2dwork.de_en&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=y--ing87i8bjbx31rh0fpphflm2jsak_2dmdnjswx2g&s=dgq9pqvpcg8q4iavpbwq3x72femohoi_omktggov43s&e=>) and are instrumental in various national and international research projects. we would like to reinforce our software administration team and are therefore searching for a software engineer to help maintain those software repositories as well as to support team members, students and external project partners in their use. candidates should have significant programming experience in c++ and preferably have already been working with the robot operating system ros. by providing links to selected software repositories they should be able to illustrate their advanced experience in working with software version control systems (specifically git). extensive knowledge in software engineering, agile development methods and associated development tools is a clear plus. detailed information on the job can be found at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__recruiting.fraunhofer.de_vacancies_33470_description_2&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=y--ing87i8bjbx31rh0fpphflm2jsak_2dmdnjswx2g&s=kds7hkphpxsydt0c6pflydb0ky9fjyhut7eva3ofp2k&e=  (in english) or https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__recruiting.fraunhofer.de_vacancies_33470_description_1&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=y--ing87i8bjbx31rh0fpphflm2jsak_2dmdnjswx2g&s=f7ywmhjliwpqod3ryeswjyjzco4i9aicvxaoa2bv8ty&e=  (in german). in order to upload your application documents (motivation letter, cv, copies of academic records including marks), please use the associated online application form. further information on the application process can be found at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.ipa.fraunhofer.de_en_jobs-2dcareers_your-5fapplication.html&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=y--ing87i8bjbx31rh0fpphflm2jsak_2dmdnjswx2g&s=e4ik9j6zujsi-kqnjwctuwt-okrm8wz9rhzz6lck9dw&e= best wishes,  birgit graf --- dr.-ing. dipl.-inf. birgit graf, fraunhofer ipa group manager domestic and personal robotics department robot and assistive systems nobelstrasse 12, d-70569 stuttgart (germany) phone +49(0)711-970-1910, fax +49(0)711-970-1008 skype: birgit.graf mailto:birgit.graf at ipa.fraunhofer.de https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ipa.fraunhofer.de_en_expertise_robot-2dand-2dassistive-2dsystems_household-2dand-2dassistive-2drobots.html&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=y--ing87i8bjbx31rh0fpphflm2jsak_2dmdnjswx2g&s=xg5mjcu5937mcz17tpjectuhzc6ueybdev6-_qopo1c&e= https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.care-2do-2dbot.de_en_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=y--ing87i8bjbx31rh0fpphflm2jsak_2dmdnjswx2g&s=7ut_ctz5t7c8grt-d5g6fzxlcghj147dkw7pszuqaly&e=

subject: phd student on "topological measures to  plan flexible objects bimanual robotic manipulation" at iri, csic-upc,  spain
content: ============================================================================================ 1 phd student position at iri, csic-upc,  spain  topological measures to plan flexible objects bimanual robotic manipulation _application deadline: 30/09/2018_ ============================================================================================  iri, csic-upc in barcelona,  spain , is seeking a phd student to work  under the framework of the european project clothilde  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_project_show_187&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0pluw8uigtex_yyoy7abllv5lpoifssmvzxhdpjliwe&s=v6amyikwhjvfsozx7b7q-xzfs5lt3v5wdi45uisat2g&e=>(erc advanced grant 2016). the phd will be supervised by dr. j?lia borr?s sol and prof. federico  thomas. about iri: iri is a joint university research institute participated by the spanish  national research council (csic) and the technical university of  catalonia (upc) that conducts research in human-centered robotics and  automatic control. the institute is a key player in the spanish robotics  and automatic control scenes, and a valued participant in a large number  of international collaborations including more than ten ongoing h2020  projects and an erc advanced grant. recently, is has been recognized as  a maria de maeztu excellence unit, the main accreditation given by the  spanish government to research units that stand out for the impact and  international relevance of their results. about clothilde project: the european project clothilde (cloth manipulation learning from  demonstration) is an erc advanced grant, awarded to dr. carme torras,  that started in january 2018. the project aim is to establish the foundations of versatile cloth  manipulation by robots. the theoretical ground will be to link machine  learning and computational topology methods, so as to come up with a  theory of cloth deformation under manipulation leading to a general  framework for robots to learn to manipulate garments from human  demonstrations. such framework will encompass: non-expert teaching of a  task, robot perception and skill learning, task-oriented cloth  representation, probabilistic planning, robot task execution in varying  initial conditions, failure diagnosis and informed requests for human help. about the position textile manipulation is intrinsically bimanual and its main challenge is  how to predict the behaviour of completely shapeless objects when they  are manipulated, in order to be able to plan an action such as folding  or covering an object. we want to exploit different gripper designs that  allow us to conform desired shapes of the pieces of cloth that are being  manipulated in a way that is meaningful for different geometric  representations of the configuration state of a bimanual system of  grippers+cloth. the main idea behind this project will be to define new  representations in terms of points or oriented lines that allow us to  extract topological and shape information from each configuration of our  grippers+cloth system. in the long term, we want to plan motions between  different configurations exploiting optimization methods based on  topological and geometric indexes. to start, we will study the gauss linking integral [1], as an index that  measures the writhe between two open polygonal curves. this index has  been recently used to synthesize motions for humanoid robots [2],  grasping [3] and manipulation through holes in the environment [4]. we  will revisit the computation of the index, its geometric interpretation  and possible improvements, and in parallel we will explore the 2d  extension of this index, starting by studying the writhe matrix between  different significant curves on a 2d surface. [1] ricca, renzo l., and bernardo nipoti. "gauss'linking number  revisited." journal of knot theory and its ramifications 20.10 (2011):  1325-1343. [2] ho, edmond sl, and taku komura. "indexing and retrieving motions of  characters in close contact." ieee transactions on visualization &  computer graphics 3 (2008): 481-492. [3] zarubin, dmitry, et al. "topological synergies for grasp transfer."  hand synergies?how to tame the complexity of grapsing, workshop, ieee  international conference on robotics and automation (icra 2013),  karlsruhe, germany. citeseer. 2013. [4] ivan, vladimir, et al. "topology-based representations for motion  planning and generalization in dynamic environments with interactions."  the international journal of robotics research 32.9-10 (2013): 1151-1163. * *requirements of the candidates the candidates can be of any nationality. s/he is expected to have a  master in mathematics, computer science or a related field, and have interest in geometry and computational topology topics _more info and how to appl__y__:_ https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_jobs_65&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0pluw8uigtex_yyoy7abllv5lpoifssmvzxhdpjliwe&s=gfzn7uaa2qdkyjgngo9wrqo4z0biv2o8iudync8mwxy&e= _application deadline:_ 30/09/2018 **we are looking forward to receiving your application. thank you. best regards, --  institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial (iri), csic-upc tel: +34 93 401 57 83, fax: +34 93 401 57 50 @iri_robotics --

subject: researcher position at dynamic  locomotion group at mpi is stuttgart and multi-level modeling in motor  control and rehabilitation robotics group
content: we are currently seeking a highly motivated researcher (female/male) we offer a potential phd candidate researcher position in our ?bioinspired and bio-mimicking legged locomotion? project, with focus on computer simulation of neuro-muscular control of legged locomotion.  the core of the project is on muscle driven legged walking and running. the aim is to develop a neuro-muscular model and perform computer simulations. the results will be transferred to and compared with biorobotic models. the project is a collaboration between the dynamic locomotion group at the max planck institute for intelligent systems on the campus stuttgart in germany and the multi-level modeling in motor control and rehabilitation robotics group at the hertie institute for clinical brain research (hih) at the university of t?bingen, germany. the project starts in march 2019. in case of an outstanding application, we can offer a temporary position starting in fall 2018 until the official start of the project. for details please see:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__dlg.is.mpg.de_jobs_researcher-2dposition-2din-2dcomputer-2dsimulation-2dof-2dneuro-2dmuscular-2dcontrol-2dof-2dlegged-2dlocomotion&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=h4a8p1wt0lwj1rkyd037wnmuwyjjozfc5yzbi_srnji&s=ztyxzl44rdifmrws4eb9gtmz1rstpox4650bbreddeg&e= https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__keeper.mpdl.mpg.de_f_386ba616db094a18873d_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=h4a8p1wt0lwj1rkyd037wnmuwyjjozfc5yzbi_srnji&s=u_ewyygtxqsnj5-bqdb8h7kfkih1ptm0xwr7blvck4c&e= with kind regards, alexander spr?witz, and daniel h?ufle

subject: post-doc in robotics at technical  university of munich - chair of robotics,  artificial intelligence and embedded systems
content: at tum?s chair of robotics, artificial intelligence and embedded systems  (prof. alois knoll) in the department of informatics, we are offering a  2 year post-doc position in robotics. your work in our group will take  place in the context of the h2020 projects robmosys  (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__robmosys.eu&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=uv-xwvpak5bkjm5vyyfniv9dqbxlkdmtqur1fk1hgui&s=fg45n9f0mqwwp8koobqr3uwa41g_-dwxhybpomjfank&e=) and tetramax (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.tetramax.eu&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=uv-xwvpak5bkjm5vyyfniv9dqbxlkdmtqur1fk1hgui&s=yqv9bnjzc-58xc1ll6u9wx3svtg_engg9bjv8k1ysl4&e=)   post-doc in robotics (full time) tetramax (technology transfer via multinational application experiments)  will provide an implementation of the european smart anything everywhere  (sae) initiative in the domain of customized and low-energy computing  for cyber physical systems and the internet of things. the goal is to  create a self-sustainable network of embedded computing competence  centers throughout europe. the project supports a series of technology  transfer experiments, whose aim is the transfer of innovative  technologies from an academic to an industrial setting. tetramax funds  these experiments and provides technical guidance as well robmosys (composable models and software for robotics  systems-of-systems)is a research and innovation project towards building  an open and sustainable european robotics software ecosystem. based on  model-driven engineering methods, robmosys is developing and promoting  standards for constructing robotics systems with the key mission of  enabling different stakeholders to certify and seamlessly compose their  work. *our group:* within one of the europe?s top universities (tum), our research group is  partner in more than ten european funded projects including: human brain  project, echord++, robmosys, tetramax, esmera, terrinet, etc.  furthermore we are highly involved in the consolidation of digital  innovation hubs in europe  (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__s3platform.jrc.ec.europa.eu_digital-2dinnovation-2dhubs&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=uv-xwvpak5bkjm5vyyfniv9dqbxlkdmtqur1fk1hgui&s=zjgtjst4iy4csft3paosio110io08z_qr366bphkk5e&e=), towards  bringing together different stakeholders around digital technologies and  industrial robotics areas. we would like you to play a relevant part in  this exciting moment in the european robotics scene. *key responsibilities:* ?carry out research activities in the field of software engineering for  robotics robotics in the context of the aforementioned projects. ?coordinate project related work including work package related tasks  and reporting ?dissemination of project results in leading journals and conference in  the robotics community ?proposal management (i.e., highlighting potential opportunities,  helping to form consortia and assistance in proposal writing) *requirements:* ?ph.d. or similar experience in the fields of robotics, model-driven  engineering or software architectures ?experience in developing robotics software, e.g., kinematics/dynamics,  control of actuators/sensors, distributed systems ?good programming skills ?experience with robotics middleware (eg. ros, yarp, orocos) ?fluency in spoken and written english, german is a plus, but not required ?willingness to travel ?high motivation and willingness to work in an international and  interdisciplinary team *what we offer:* ?a responsible position with interesting and challenging tasks in an  interdisciplinary scientific and management team ?worldwide networking opportunities with leading robotics experts ?the opportunity to actively design the scientific scope of the european  robotics software ecosystem and the research directions covered (in  strong alignment with the scientific foci of robmosys) ?the opportunity to grow the role and the responsibility through the  development of new project opportunities ?remuneration in line with the current german public service salary  scale tv-l, level e13 *interested?* please send your application to eloy retamino (retamino at in.tum.de)including: ?a motivation letter ?two references ?any other material to you consider interesting for your application:  linkedin, github, code or publications you are particularly proud of applications will be accepted until finding the right candidate. the  starting date is as soon as possible, though we offer some flexibility.  please note that only shortlisted applications will be contacted. tum has been pursuing the strategic goal of substantially increasing the  diversity of its staff. as an equal opportunity and affirmative action  employer, tum explicitly encourages nominations of and applications from  women as well as from all others who would bring additional diversity  dimensions to the university?s research and teaching strategies.  preference will be given to disabled candidates with essentially the  same qualifications. international candidates are highly encouraged to  apply. --  *anna principato, m.a.* /public relations specialist/ technische universit?t m?nchen department of informatics vi robotics, artificial intelligence and embedded systems schlei?heimer str. 90a 85748 garching bei m?nchen germany telefon | phone: +49 (0)89 289-18127 telefax | fax: +49 (0)89 289-18107  raum | office: 0.010 anna.principato at in.tum.de https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www6.in.tum.de_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=uv-xwvpak5bkjm5vyyfniv9dqbxlkdmtqur1fk1hgui&s=p3ia_fb8prkzyrhvxr3rbmnvnwchl7t2yfgnf_hjusa&e=

subject: phd (or postdoc) position in visual  robot navigation or cognitive robotics @ bielefeld university
content: at the computer engineering group, faculty of technology, bielefeld  university, we offer a  ? phd (or postdoc) position with research in either visual robot  navigation or cognitive robotics  ? (full position, 3 years, pay group tv-l e13). in the field of visual robot navigation, your task would be to develop  methods for the visual navigation of autonomous mobile robots in indoor  and outdoor environments, particularly for controlling cleaning robots  and autonomous lawn mowers. in the field of cognitive robotics, your task would be to develop  methods for learning internal sensorimotor models in the interaction of  a robot with its environment. these models should then be applied for  interpreting visual information and selecting appropriate actions from a  process of internal simulation. your tasks will be: - research in one of the areas mentioned above, including the  construction of robot hardware (70%); - teaching (4 course hours per week) in computer engineering and  robotics (20%); - assistance with tasks in teaching, research, and organisation (10%). we expect: - completed university education in computer science, engineering,  mathematics, physics, or related subjects; - very good mathematical abilities and programming skills; - independent, responsible, and committed working; - very good communication skills. we favor applicants with experience in computer vision, robotics, neural  networks, and cognitive sciences. official offer (in german):  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ti.uni-2dbielefeld.de_html_offers_index.html&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wsq7cbuprxr-kshydiqph9zulb6bzgo2hpm67wof0cq&s=e5rt5nealeaq942usos8t9ksyefjv8veo2jqgynfgqk&e= please send your application in a single pdf document to  bewerbung at ti.uni-bielefeld.de application deadline: september 6th, 2018. --  prof. dr.-ing. ralf moeller computer engineering group, faculty of technology, bielefeld university pob 10 01 31, d-33501 bielefeld, germany (room d4-150) phone +49 (0)521 106-5272 (secretary), fax +49 (0)521 106-6440 mailto:moeller at ti.uni-bielefeld.de https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ti.uni-2dbielefeld.de_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wsq7cbuprxr-kshydiqph9zulb6bzgo2hpm67wof0cq&s=vrpov8vezkmcivym4ds468i3aoviicr-setiqrbm1d4&e=

subject: magazino is hiring a team leader robot  navigation & localization
content: dear robot enthusiasts, magazino stands for robotics in a real-world application. with over 100  employees, we are one of the largest advanced robotics teams in europe,  located in munich, germany. we develop and produce the next generation  of perception-driven robots that can navigate through warehouses and  pick items from the shelves. to take the robots to the next level in  terms of navigation and localization, we are looking for a team leader  for our navigation & localization team. you are in the field of robot localization and navigation solutions and  you experienced a first role in leading a team? we are looking forward  to receive your application for the following job  description:https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__magazino-2djobs.personio.de_job_36601-3flanguage-3den-23&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=odpjtjww03lokycxn_6o66j1jmrjw6snkfwgnulsb3e&s=6e1jhsz38ujgjollrvizxhkvsfxa4dgytvcdolq9tk8&e=  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__magazino-2djobs.personio.de_job_36601-3flanguage-3den-23&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=odpjtjww03lokycxn_6o66j1jmrjw6snkfwgnulsb3e&s=6e1jhsz38ujgjollrvizxhkvsfxa4dgytvcdolq9tk8&e=> as magazino is constantly growing, you can find information on more job  openings on the following link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.magazino.eu_jobs-2d2_-3flang-3den&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=odpjtjww03lokycxn_6o66j1jmrjw6snkfwgnulsb3e&s=l7_z9mentkq1hjjivzddjy2qen_3vsknfhotods2f8a&e= if you are interested, you can directly contact my colleague julia  scholz (scholz at magazino.eu <mailto:scholz at magazino.eu>) or sent us your  cv to jobs at magazino.eu <mailto:jobs at magazino.eu> best regards, moritz tenorth --  dr. moritz tenorth cto magazino gmbh landsberger str. 234 80687 m?nchen t +49-89-21552415-8 f +49-89-21552415-9 m +49-170-543 1717 tenorth at magazino.eu www.magazino.eu amtsgericht m?nchen hrb 209758 ust-idnr.: de293308625 gesch?ftsf?hrer: frederik brantner, lukas zanger

subject: software developers at mojin robotics  (stuttgart, germany)
content: company description mojin robotics ([https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.mojin-2drobotics.de-5d-28http-3a__www.mojin-2drobotics.de_-29&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=5syjgutczfvycegnn-0b4nuvsslfrt31ubbvze9prq4&s=n-5hbqenlnk8vem4fq_2wewddmdgjdxq1dt65lsu65u&e=) is a spin-off from fraunhofer ipa and is passionate about developing enhanced service robots for various applications in everyday environments, from retail and hospitality to care applications. combining robotics with semantic dialog systems and artificial intelligence, the company developed a mobile robot that simplifies different areas of life. with its unique technology, it brings the quality of life and work to a new level. the aim is to bring intelligent mobile robotics to everyday environments and enable users to interact with the technology in an intuitive and natural way. mojin was awarded with the fraunhofer start-up award 2018. see the robot in action as robot "paul" at an electronics retailer https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.youtube.com_watch-3fv-3d9igwavvennc&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=5syjgutczfvycegnn-0b4nuvsslfrt31ubbvze9prq4&s=0-kjd6rk3gg-upfkrut8uv73ywjlflrv0dnohwqxyq8&e= and at german tv galileo https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.youtube.com_watch-3fv-3dsnoz44czbjq&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=5syjgutczfvycegnn-0b4nuvsslfrt31ubbvze9prq4&s=jtuabx4nsxicueczonskgyn3ep4bpmjv9-dnls5aptq&e=. we are searching for software developers with strong programming skills in c++, python and/or java in linux environments for the following positions: - software testing engineer with experience in testing distributed software systems and hardware - software developer ros with experience in developing and maintaining ros software - software developer ai with experience in interfacing and integrating ai systems - software developer image processing, person/face detection and tracking - robotics navigation expert with experience in developing path planning and localization algorithms (slam) for mobile robots - software developer speech recognition with experience in speech recognition systems like google dialogflow, google assistant, alexa, siri - application engineer ros with experience in developing complex state machines - embedded software developer with strong linux background and experience in implementing low level device control experience: - bs, ms or phd in computer science or related field. - 3+ years experience in software development. mandatory requirements: - strong c++, python and/or java skills - experience in developing software in linux systems - proficiency in writing clean, well-organized code with appropriate abstraction boundaries - experience in using version control (git) and unittesting/continuous integration - experience designing and deploying complex systems - strong communication skills and ability to work with academic and industrial partners - fluent in written and spoken english - attention to detail and a passion for correctness - a plus is experience with real robots in real environment using ros you will work in a scrum-based agile development cycle. you will be working alongside founders, researchers, and engineers to design and build first-generation robotic solutions for mass consumer adoption. please send your application to info at mojin-robotics.de.

subject: phd student on "topological measures to  plan flexible objects bimanual robotic manipulation" at iri, csic-upc,  spain
content: ============================================================================================ 1 phd student position at iri, csic-upc,  spain  topological measures to plan flexible objects bimanual robotic manipulation _application deadline: 30/09/2018_ ============================================================================================  iri, csic-upc in barcelona,  spain , is seeking a phd student to work  under the framework of the european project clothilde  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_project_show_187&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=f209_89ei2fxouodd2xokx2k2zffeclhsqlm7c9xusg&s=jixjitpwzknjnpdsuhka5basbgsx1_kkhoomibf_kdo&e=>(erc advanced grant 2016). the phd will be supervised by dr. j?lia borr?s sol and prof. federico  thomas. about iri: iri is a joint university research institute participated by the spanish  national research council (csic) and the technical university of  catalonia (upc) that conducts research in human-centered robotics and  automatic control. the institute is a key player in the spanish robotics  and automatic control scenes, and a valued participant in a large number  of international collaborations including more than ten ongoing h2020  projects and an erc advanced grant. recently, is has been recognized as  a maria de maeztu excellence unit, the main accreditation given by the  spanish government to research units that stand out for the impact and  international relevance of their results. about clothilde project: the european project clothilde (cloth manipulation learning from  demonstration) is an erc advanced grant, awarded to dr. carme torras,  that started in january 2018. the project aim is to establish the foundations of versatile cloth  manipulation by robots. the theoretical ground will be to link machine  learning and computational topology methods, so as to come up with a  theory of cloth deformation under manipulation leading to a general  framework for robots to learn to manipulate garments from human  demonstrations. such framework will encompass: non-expert teaching of a  task, robot perception and skill learning, task-oriented cloth  representation, probabilistic planning, robot task execution in varying  initial conditions, failure diagnosis and informed requests for human help. about the position textile manipulation is intrinsically bimanual and its main challenge is  how to predict the behaviour of completely shapeless objects when they  are manipulated, in order to be able to plan an action such as folding  or covering an object. we want to exploit different gripper designs that  allow us to conform desired shapes of the pieces of cloth that are being  manipulated in a way that is meaningful for different geometric  representations of the configuration state of a bimanual system of  grippers+cloth. the main idea behind this project will be to define new  representations in terms of points or oriented lines that allow us to  extract topological and shape information from each configuration of our  grippers+cloth system. in the long term, we want to plan motions between  different configurations exploiting optimization methods based on  topological and geometric indexes. to start, we will study the gauss linking integral [1], as an index that  measures the writhe between two open polygonal curves. this index has  been recently used to synthesize motions for humanoid robots [2],  grasping [3] and manipulation through holes in the environment [4]. we  will revisit the computation of the index, its geometric interpretation  and possible improvements, and in parallel we will explore the 2d  extension of this index, starting by studying the writhe matrix between  different significant curves on a 2d surface. [1] ricca, renzo l., and bernardo nipoti. "gauss'linking number  revisited." journal of knot theory and its ramifications 20.10 (2011):  1325-1343. [2] ho, edmond sl, and taku komura. "indexing and retrieving motions of  characters in close contact." ieee transactions on visualization &  computer graphics 3 (2008): 481-492. [3] zarubin, dmitry, et al. "topological synergies for grasp transfer."  hand synergies?how to tame the complexity of grapsing, workshop, ieee  international conference on robotics and automation (icra 2013),  karlsruhe, germany. citeseer. 2013. [4] ivan, vladimir, et al. "topology-based representations for motion  planning and generalization in dynamic environments with interactions."  the international journal of robotics research 32.9-10 (2013): 1151-1163. * *requirements of the candidates the candidates can be of any nationality. s/he is expected to have a  master in mathematics, computer science or a related field, and have interest in geometry and computational topology topics _more info and how to appl__y__:_ https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_jobs_65&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=f209_89ei2fxouodd2xokx2k2zffeclhsqlm7c9xusg&s=p_dzbzc3u6otgti111zoe49mdfmpnlafe4w_tizh0y8&e= _application deadline:_ 30/09/2018 **we are looking forward to receiving your application. thank you. best regards, --  institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial (iri), csic-upc tel: +34 93 401 57 83, fax: +34 93 401 57 50 @iri_robotics --

subject: team lead navigation at magazino --  meet us at roscon and iros in madrid
content: dear robot enthusiasts, you have the possibility to meet us directly at the roscon and iros  (booth no. 85) and also see our robot toru there. magazino stands for robotics in a real-world application. with over 100  employees, we are one of the biggest advanced-robotics teams in europe,  located in munich, germany. we develop and produce the next generation  of perception-driven robots, that can navigate through warehouses and  pick items from the shelves. to take the robots to the next level in terms of navigation and  localization, we are looking for a team lead for our navigation &  localization team. you are passionate about robots and want to be part  of the biggest advanced robotics teams in europe? talk to our colleagues  about our current job openings or directly apply to jobs at magazino.eu *team lead navigation & localization  (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__magazino-2djobs.personio.de_job_36601-3flanguage-3den-23&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=gtbfgnu2mhzv8zopezrtj72r_iwy6zeo1kgvlbgbg6k&s=-i0zy8nvejqtuu09dod-ryap9ruusqcgmcdzci7lkzs&e=) subject: postdoctoral position in robot learning  at tum
content: the human-centered assistive robotics (hcr) lab at technical university of munich (tum) is looking for a talented postdoctoral researcher in the field of robot learning. the expected research area includes cognitive robot motor skill learning and reinforcement learning with the focus on learning dynamics and context based skill manipulation learning. working environment: the appointed researcher will be based at the human-centered assistive robotics group (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.hcr.ei.tum.de_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nec7wdvpiizlfx6dg4loj_sivh_7ntnptxl3j3rpf9y&s=fgceopv7wo3wqhgcp-av4l-jj3sl8uqczxx-9ajbw8c&e=) at tum under the supervision of prof. dongheui lee. the new position offers the opportunity to engage in national and international collaboration, especially tight collaboration with the institute of robotics and mechatronics at german aerospace center (dlr).  the research group has access to a number of robotic platforms such as light weight robotic arms, humanoid robots, motion capturing systems, etc at tum and dlr. requirements: *       phd degree in engineering, computer science, or equivalent. *       excellent mathematical and coding skills (c/c++, matlab, ros, python). *       excellent skills and experience in machine learning, robotics, and control *       proficiency in writing and speaking english. *       publications in recognized conferences/journals *       interested to be engaged in teaching and education at tum start: the position is available immediately. applications. interested candidates are invited to send application to dhlee at tum.de <mailto:%0ddhlee at tum.de%20> including a cv, transcripts, a motivation letter, and a list of references. ------------------------------------------------- prof. dr. dongheui lee associate professor human-centered assistive robotics technical university of munich (tum) tel. +49 89 289 25780 dhlee at tum.de<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.hcr.ei.tum.de_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nec7wdvpiizlfx6dg4loj_sivh_7ntnptxl3j3rpf9y&s=fgceopv7wo3wqhgcp-av4l-jj3sl8uqczxx-9ajbw8c&e=> www.hcr.ei.tum.de<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.hcr.ei.tum.de_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nec7wdvpiizlfx6dg4loj_sivh_7ntnptxl3j3rpf9y&s=fgceopv7wo3wqhgcp-av4l-jj3sl8uqczxx-9ajbw8c&e=> subject: phd (or postdoctoral) position in  robotics at tum
content: the human-centered assistive robotics (hcr) lab at technical university of munich (tum) is looking for a talented phd candidate (or postdoctoral researcher) in the field of robotics. the candidate will participate the interdisciplinary project on "life-span development of high-order body representations for the control of body balance: role of prediction during light haptic interactions with another individual". the appointed person will investigate self-perception and self-other distinction in the context of body balance control during human robot interaction. the expected research area includes haptics, teleoperation, and dynamics modeling of postural balance. working environment: the appointed researcher will be based at the human-centered assistive robotics group (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.hcr.ei.tum.de_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vc8tgymm0-euwgu3lpge3leiec6vlvje2ip0eh8gaby&s=zyiofblp9ywmdsquapvrki0uohxwhx4ulefgczctkps&e=) at tum under the supervision of prof. dongheui lee at tum and dr. leif johannsen at uea norwich. the new position offers the opportunity to engage in national and international collaboration in the dfg spp program "active self" and collaboration with the institute of robotics and mechatronics at german aerospace center (dlr).  the research group has access to a number of robotic platforms such as light weight robotic arms, humanoid robots, teleoperation systems, motion capturing systems, etc at tum and dlr. requirements: *       master (phd) degree in engineering, computer science, or equivalent. *       excellent mathematical and coding skills (c/c++, matlab, ros, python). *       excellent skills and experience in teleoperation, robotics, and control *       proficiency in writing and speaking english. *       publications in recognized conferences/journals *       interested to be engaged in teaching and education at tum start: the position is available immediately. applications: interested candidates are invited to send application to dhlee at tum.de <mailto:%0ddhlee at tum.de%20> including a cv, transcripts, a motivation letter, and a list of references. ------------------------------------------------- prof. dr. dongheui lee associate professor human-centered assistive robotics technical university of munich (tum) tel. +49 89 289 25780 dhlee at tum.de<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.hcr.ei.tum.de_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vc8tgymm0-euwgu3lpge3leiec6vlvje2ip0eh8gaby&s=zyiofblp9ywmdsquapvrki0uohxwhx4ulefgczctkps&e=> www.hcr.ei.tum.de<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.hcr.ei.tum.de_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vc8tgymm0-euwgu3lpge3leiec6vlvje2ip0eh8gaby&s=zyiofblp9ywmdsquapvrki0uohxwhx4ulefgczctkps&e=> subject: junior professorship in machine  learning at hu berlin
content: the faculty of mathematics and natural sciences, department of computer science, of humboldt-universitaet zu berlin, germany, invites applications for a *** junior professorship in machine learning ***         (w1 tenure track leading to w2) starting as soon as possible. the ideal candidate for this position is an acknowledged expert in foundational and/or applied topics in machine learning. we expect independent teaching, an outstanding research profile, and the (proven) willingness to engage in collaborative and interdisciplinary research projects. we are particularly interested in researchers specializing in topics in the life sciences, geoscience or natural language processing / text mining. we offer numerous possibilities to participate in ongoing and future research initiatives (such as the newly founded cluster of excellence ?science of intelligence?, www.scienceofintelligence.de), a vibrant research environment and highly engaged and dedicated students. the complete announcement can be found here: german: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.personalabteilung.hu-2dberlin.de_stellenausschreibungen_juniorprofessur-2dfuer-2dmaschinelles-2dlernen&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=zmj9-z3cweuyk5o_udi-ypu7umwtwukwuku7m6vb2m0&s=fraerlq4jkymbj3szrlvbynkh7tgf0ski01yexc4oak&e= subject: postdoc position at fortiss in munich
content: please find at the following link a postdoc position in the automated systems group of the fortiss research institute in munich: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.fortiss.org_karriere_wissenschaftliche-2dmitarbeiter_-3ftx-5fttnews-255btt-5fnews-255d-3d757-26chash-3d3463b9665823c10acf30d53d332bbdd4&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=r1bado_s1ctbwrperxtuvotceomj9uloqq3isvaspbm&s=juv16f8goykvairngtpxkdscuaa3bb5h7ir5wxlmmdy&e= best regards, vincent aravantinos -- fortiss ? landesforschungsinstitut des freistaats bayern an-institut technische universit?t m?nchen guerickestra?e 25 80805 m?nchen germany tel.: +49 (89) 3603522 560 fax: +49 (89) 3603522 50 e-mail: aravantinos at fortiss.org<mailto:aravantinos at fortiss.org> https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.fortiss.org&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=r1bado_s1ctbwrperxtuvotceomj9uloqq3isvaspbm&s=_ydf_5284pr--xyz8wm6iubqphwefueedkvvo6rnk8q&e=<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.fortiss.org_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=r1bado_s1ctbwrperxtuvotceomj9uloqq3isvaspbm&s=sh1fxljvvcv8-r5c6b8xhpf3nurzvygv6c6pcmkwoto&e=> amtsgericht m?nchen: hrb: 176633 ust-idnr.: de263907002, steuer-nr.: 143/237/25900 rechtsform: gemeinn?tzige gmbh sitz der gesellschaft: m?nchen gesch?ftsf?hrer: dr. harald rue?, thomas vallon vorsitzender des aufsichtsrats: dr. manfred wolter

subject: phd student research position at  ben-gurion university of the negev - older adults interaction with robots
content: 12-18 months ph.d. student research position in older adults' interaction with robots department of communication studies department of industrial engineering and management the center for multidisciplinary research in aging agricultural, biological, cognitive robotics initiative ben-gurion university of the negev ben-gurion university of the negev (bgu) is seeking outstanding candidates for a phd student position in older adults' interaction with robots, at the departments of communication studies and industrial engineering and management and the center for multidisciplinary research in aging. bgu is an internationally recognized research university that attracts outstanding faculty and researchers from around the world with over 19,000 students. the dept. of communication studies includes a multidisciplinary faculty with expertise in new media, audience research, cultural diversity and disadvantaged populations. the dept. of industrial engineering includes faculty experts in human factors and robotics. advanced innovative multidisciplinary robotics research at bgu is conducted under the auspices of the abc robotics initiative. socrates the recruitment is done as part of socrates (social cognitive robotic agents in the european society), a marie sk?odowska-curie european training network (etn) comprising 7 universities/research institutes: ume? university and ?rebro university in  sweden , universit?t hamburg and fraunhofer ipa, stuttgart in germany, csic barcelona in  spain , university west of england, and ben-gurion university of the negev in israel. additional non-academic partners are: pal robotics, adele robots, alfred nobel science park, urquhart-dykes & lord llp, center for digital innovation, uminova, asea brown boveri, s.a, and fundaci? ace. in total 15 early stage researchers (esrs) were recruited as phd students for research on various aspects of social robotics aiming at eldercare. the wide range of projects covers a spectrum from technical design of hardware and interaction methodology, to personalization, user studies, and robot ethics. the researchers receive training in both academic and entrepreneurial spirit and expertise, well suited for a career in both academy and industry. the training includes working on a research project related to older adults' interaction with robots, as well as courses, seminars, and workshops suited for the students' academic interests and progress. as part of the research project and time dependent, secondments at ?rebro university,  sweden  and/or at fraunhofer ipa, germany might be planned. an overview of the socrates project can be found at www.socrates-project.eu<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.socrates-2dproject.eu&d=dwif_w&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dxxvsbxw1kz_ztwtdcydmis94rcwq0lqp1thj1c6crc&s=lnrdb01nism5syhdqrtnn-87g78cf9xx3n2qlo8k6xg&e=>. about the position the successful applicant will receive a competitive salary for a period of 12 months' full time research, provided that expected study and research results are achieved. no teaching is expected. the salary will be based on the standard marie sk?odowska-curie early-stage researcher living and mobility allowances. starting date: asap. who can apply? 1.      excellent msc students, who already graduated their studies and interested in exploring the new and exciting field of human-robot interaction. 2.      phd students, who have not yet graduated and interested in extending their work by including a component on older adults. in this case, the students will still be formally registered in their current university, and the time spent at bgu will be considered as student exchange. admission requirements candidates should have interest in understanding aging and human-robot interaction (although should not necessarily have background in such topics), be able to work independently as well as in collaboration with others, and be passionate about learning and developing knowledge in a novel and exciting area. the applicant must be skilled in both oral and written communication in english. some background in social sciences and/or user studies is a significant advantage but not mandatory. once approved by bgu?s socrates graduate committee the student must obtain a visa and working permit according to the ministry of interior requirements. applicants aiming to pursue a phd must be accepted to bgu?s graduate school (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__in.bgu.ac.il_en_kreitman-5fschool_pages_admission.aspx&d=dwif_w&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dxxvsbxw1kz_ztwtdcydmis94rcwq0lqp1thj1c6crc&s=zotphf3g2bxlsbmif635xwh3fankqgvwyokz9rmt39e&e=). the phd candidate must submit a research proposal and go through a qualification exam within one year of studies on his/her research proposal. a phd at bgu is usually 4 years; for funding in the following years the student can apply for bgu scholarships and awards https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__in.bgu.ac.il_en_kreitman-5fschool_pages_scholarships-2dand-2dawards.aspx&d=dwif_w&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dxxvsbxw1kz_ztwtdcydmis94rcwq0lqp1thj1c6crc&s=tropb65rv4jpqw4froz5ctvley1ugijand-3arcu_yo&e=. to promote mobility, the following rule applies: at the time of recruitment, the applicants must not have resided or carried out their main activity in israel for more than 12 months during the last 3 years. compulsory national service, work in international organizations, and short stays such as holidays are not taken into account. the applicants must not, at the time of recruitment, have spent more than 4 years doing research, and must not have been awarded a doctoral degree. application a complete application should contain the following documents: ?        a cover letter including a description of your research interests, your reasons to apply for the position, and your contact information. ?        a curriculum vita. ?        copies of degree certificates, including documentation of completed academic courses and grades. ?        copy of completed ma/msc thesis and other original research publications. ?        contact information for three persons willing to act as references (including your ma/msc thesis advisor). applications must be submitted electronically to the following email by november 30, 2018. socrates at post.bgu.ac.il<mailto:socrates at post.bgu.ac.il> applications will be accepted until the position is filled. for additional information about the position, please contact: prof. galit nimrod - gnimrod at bgu.ac.il<mailto:gnimrod at bgu.ac.il>                                                                                                                    prof. yael edan - yael at bgu.ac.il for general information about the socrates project, please contact prof. thomas hellstr?m ?                                                                                                                                                      thomash at cs.umu.se www.socrates-project.eu<file:///d:\socrates\call%204%20students\www.socrates-project.eu> www.bgu.ac.il<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.bgu.ac.il&d=dwif_w&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dxxvsbxw1kz_ztwtdcydmis94rcwq0lqp1thj1c6crc&s=fi6nwdmtqwvntykzicylbcugrb3hryxqglfe6dkambg&e=> www.bgu.ac.il/abc-robotics<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.bgu.ac.il_abc-2drobotics&d=dwif_w&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dxxvsbxw1kz_ztwtdcydmis94rcwq0lqp1thj1c6crc&s=nqmiicsvbxsprmgfsy7hnmmg_vrtaytcxzqj3kfejsi&e=>

subject: post doc in robotics at technical  university of munich
content: *tum looking for a post-doc in robotics/software engineering who       will work on modeling and implementing a software architecture for       a generalised robotic framework* the candidate will join our team at the chair of robotics, artificial  intelligence and embedded systems (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www6.in.tum.de&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=y016jmdlmwevhqq-h-axfstdj-rnnyhqxrrrx7ikbv4&s=-lcjeot5yhgi7j27z0p0-a5_ygnenourws4y-mqb51m&e=) at technical  university of munich (tum). your work will mainly focus in the context  of the h2020 project robmosys (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__robmosys.eu&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=y016jmdlmwevhqq-h-axfstdj-rnnyhqxrrrx7ikbv4&s=nb4h9r39dyx2hh8bkpjswybnmjcvcvh3vrzjqsze8dy&e=). we aim to develop a  meta-level robotics framework, that will build on top of current  code-centric robotic platforms by applying model-driven methods and  tools. this will enable the management of interfaces between different  robotics-related domains in an efficient and systematic way according to  each system?s needs. thus, modules within the framework can be easily  configured to interact with each other in a guaranteed manner,  regardless of manufacturer. you will be involved in the design of our software architecture towards  a generalized world and perception model and work on its implementation  in a consulting and/or supervising position, in conjunction with  internal and external teams. the initial position is limited to two years and may be extended based  on your performance. *?key responsibilities:* ?working independently on at least one european funded project,  including implementing research tasks in conjunction with other european  research agencies ?carrying out research activities towards a generalized software  architecture for robotic platforms ?involvement in the consulting and supervision of third party r&d projects ?presentation of project results in leading journals, conferences and  other events ?participation in third party funding acquisition (european and/or  national level) *requirements:* ?applicants must have earned a phd in in robotics, computer science,  math or other robotics- and/or software engineering-related discipline  prior to position start date ?understanding of the high-level robotic concepts, especially  perception, world modelling and task planning ?detailed understanding of robotic software architectures and modelling  tools, such as uml ?sound programming experience (preferably c++, java and/or python) ?hands on experience with established robotic software frameworks,  libraries and tools (ros moveit!, opencv, pcl) is helpful ?fluency in spoken and written english, german is an advantage ?high motivation and willingness to work in an international and  interdisciplinary team *what we offer: * ?worldwide networking opportunities with leading robotics experts ?opportunities to attend project meetings in various international locations ?the opportunity to grow your role and responsibilities through the  development of new project opportunities ?the possibility to bring in own ideas for new research projects and  follow them in case of successful funding acquisition ?remuneration in line with the current german public service salary  scale tv-l, level e13 *interested? * ** please send your complete application documents online to dr. adam  schmidt (adam.schmidt at tum.de) including at least two references.the  vacant position will be filled at the earliest possible date. tum has been pursuing the strategic goal of substantially increasing the  diversity of its staff. as an equal opportunity and affirmative action  employer, tum explicitly encourages nominations of and applications from  women as well as from all others who would bring additional diversity  dimensions to the university?s research and teaching strategies.  preference will be given to disabled candidates with essentially the  same qualifications. international candidates are highly encouraged to  apply. --  *anna principato, m.a.* /public relations specialist/ technische universit?t m?nchen department of informatics vi robotics, artificial intelligence and embedded systems schlei?heimer str. 90a 85748 garching bei m?nchen germany telefon | phone: +49 (0)89 289-18127 telefax | fax: +49 (0)89 289-18107  raum | office: 0.010 anna.principato at in.tum.de https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www6.in.tum.de_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=y016jmdlmwevhqq-h-axfstdj-rnnyhqxrrrx7ikbv4&s=vdwst8hiscvvmofpv9wmc4y1z0bfhxt0byocm8pra2i&e=

subject: funded ph.d. positions at the  international max planck research school for intelligent systems
content: the max planck institute for intelligent systems and the universities of stuttgart and t?bingen jointly offer an interdisciplinary ph.d. program, the international max planck research school for intelligent systems (imprs-is).   this doctoral program will accept its third generation of ph.d. students in spring 2019.  we seek students who want to earn a doctorate while contributing to world-leading research in areas such as   ? robotics  ? biomechanics and biorobotics  ? micro- and nano-robotics  ? haptics and hri  ? machine learning  ? computer vision  ? computer graphics  ? perceptual inference  ? control systems the 32 participating faculty are frank allg?wer, philipp berens, matthias bethge, michael j. black, andr?s bruhn, martin butz, caterina de bacco, peer fischer, andreas geiger, martin a. giese, matthias hein, philipp hennig, ardian jusufi, katherine j. kuchenbecker, hendrik lensch, falk lieder, georg martius, mi jung park, ludovic righetti, syn schmitt, bernhard sch?lkopf, gabriele schweikert, fabian sinz, metin sitti, alexander spr?witz, ingo steinwart, j?rg stueckler, marc toussaint, sebastian trimpe, isabel valera, ulrike von luxburg, and felix wichmann. this school is a key element of baden-w?rttemberg?s cyber valley initiative to accelerate basic research and commercial development in artificial intelligence in our region.  intelligent systems that can successfully perceive, act, and learn in complex environments hold great potential for aiding society.  to advance human knowledge in this domain, we need doctoral students who are curious, creative, and passionate about research to join our school.  learn more at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__imprs.is.mpg.de&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=db-5ksst0kf4qwdg1hcct7twwpcxmoqvqttia0bhxdk&s=06oguqifhmkutl3u63regu6o7qpgsem3mjnwknmpz1s&e=  ? all aspects of the program are in english.  ? you may join our program in spring, summer, or fall of 2019.  ? you will be mentored by our internationally renowned faculty.  ? you will register as a university graduate student and conduct research for approximately three years.  ? you can take part in a wide variety of scientific seminars, advanced training workshops, and social activities.  ? your doctoral degree will be conferred when you successfully complete your ph.d. project.  ? our dedicated coordinator will assist you throughout your time as a doctoral student. people with a strong academic background and a master?s degree in engineering, computer science, cognitive science, mathematics, control theory, neuroscience, materials science, physics, or related fields should apply. we seek to increase the number of women in areas where they are underrepresented, so we explicitly encourage women to apply.  we are committed to employing more handicapped individuals and especially encourage them to apply.  we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our institutions. admission will be competitive.  if selected, you will receive funding via an employment contract, subject to the rules of the max planck society and the two participating universities. you can apply for free via our online portal before midday cet on november 15, 2018.  note that recommendation letters must also be submitted by this time.  the selection interviews will take place between january 29 and february 1, 2019 in stuttgart and tu?bingen, germany. for further information, please visit our website at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__imprs.is.mpg.de&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=db-5ksst0kf4qwdg1hcct7twwpcxmoqvqttia0bhxdk&s=06oguqifhmkutl3u63regu6o7qpgsem3mjnwknmpz1s&e= ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ katherine j. kuchenbecker, ph.d. director, haptic intelligence department managing director, stuttgart site spokesperson, imprs-is max planck institute for intelligent systems heisenbergstr. 3, 70569 stuttgart, germany +49 711 689-3510 kjk at is.mpg.de https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__hi.is.mpg.de&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=db-5ksst0kf4qwdg1hcct7twwpcxmoqvqttia0bhxdk&s=r-fo0echtwozeso2catttvtmpenjay4lpsa9r4uvv6s&e= ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

subject: phd scholarship in robot learning,  university of luebeck, germany
content: phd scholarship: the institute for robotics and cognitive systems (www.rob.uni-luebeck.de <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.rob.uni-2dluebeck.de_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=aqjbbudnuga8g7y-oqwzu1kmfmnkkdnlxw1nj9lta9a&s=sazq5ezlk4shi571retx-uej9evrkoscsfou-h1ny5y&e=>) at the university of l?beck has an open phd position in the area of robotics, control and neural networks. the phd position is fully funded for 3 years with a monthly stipend of 1,600 eur.  project: probabilistic and neural control mechanisms in robot learning robotics is a vastly growing field with enormous potential for autonomous intelligent assistants in everyday tasks. one of the major unsolved challenges however is to compute decisions and control signals in few milliseconds from a huge stream of uncertain sensory observations. the goal of this project is to develop novel probabilistic evidence integration and control algorithms based on neural networks. a key feature of the models is the ability to maintain and continuously update multiple action strategies for realtime control to quickly adapt to changing environmental conditions. the algorithms will be tested in challenging and exciting human robot interaction tasks for manipulation, grasping and navigation. for further information regarding the project, please visit our web page: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__rob.ai-2dlab.science&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=aqjbbudnuga8g7y-oqwzu1kmfmnkkdnlxw1nj9lta9a&s=sjasp-oatiqxruvsg5v4efjg56mi2atcm9blitnbzdk&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__rob.ai-2dlab.science_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=aqjbbudnuga8g7y-oqwzu1kmfmnkkdnlxw1nj9lta9a&s=6yiakfxsjbdomajc0imthkfrbuulj2ueca99kqlvpoc&e=> or contact prof. elmar rueckert  (rueckert at rob.uni-luebeck.de <mailto:rueckert at rob.uni-luebeck.de> or +49 (0)451 3101 5209). requirements: students (m/f) with a master's degree (or equivalent) in computer science, mathematics, physics or engineering are invited to apply. a strong background in robotics, mathematics or machine learning is highly desirable. excellent programming skills, analytical problem solving and organizational abilities are required. application details: the earliest starting date is the 1st february 2019 and the planned duration of the project is 3 years. a full application consists of: (1) a detailed cv, (2) a statement of motivation, (3) two letters of recommendation, (4) your master?s thesis as pdf, (5) all relevant degree certificates and grade transcripts: secondary school leaving certificate, bachelor's degree certificate, master's/diploma degree certificate (please attach certified translations in german/english, if the original copies are in other languages). previous publications (e.g. from msc studies) are not required but will be considered in favour of the candidate. please submit your application via email to elmar rueckert jobs at rob.uni-luebeck.de <mailto:jobs at rob.uni-luebeck.de> --  prof. dr. elmar rueckert university of luebeck m:	+49 451 3101 5209 a:	ratzeburger allee 160, 23538 l?beck, germany w:	rob.ai-lab.science  e: rueckert at rob.uni-luebeck.de

subject: two fully funded ph.d. positions and  several fully funded internship at the bmw group
content: dear colleagues, two fully ph.d. positions as well as several fully fund internship are potentially available from 2019 in the field of robotics, artificial intelligence, and machine learning at the bmw group, the department of research, new technologies, and innovations, (research e/e architectures, technologies), in munich, germany. we seek for talented students who highly motivated to earn a doctorate or complete master thesis in areas such as   *   robotics   *   robot learning   *   active visio-tactile perception and learning   *   transfer learning in deep learning   *   transfer learning reinforcement learning   *   visio-tactile navigation and path planning   *   semantic reasoning requirements for the ph.d. positions:   *   you have a master?s degree in a relevant field (e.g., robotics, computer science, engineering including e.g. electrical and mechanical engineering, statistics & optimization, math and physics).   *   you have a proven programming skills, in particular c++ and/or python.   *   you have hands-on experience with frameworks such as tensorflow, pytorch, scikit-learn, opencv, etc.   *   you are fluent in english. note: your publication at one of the top international conference (icra, iros, nips, etc.,..) or high-rank journals in robotics, ai, and machine learning (tro, autonomous robots, ra-l, ijrr, ..) is a strong merit. requirements for the internship/master thesis:   *   you are in your second year of master program in electrical engineering, computer science, math, and physics.   *   you have already passed some relevant courses a relevant field such as statistical signal processing, information theory, machine learning, robotics, and etc.,? with top grades.   *   you have a provable programming skills in particular c++ and/or python.   *   you are fluent in english. how to apply:   *   there is no fixed deadline: the positions will be filled as soon as possible.   *   ph.d. applicants should provide at least a research statement, a pdf with their cv, degrees, and grade-sheets, and two references who are willing to write a recommendation letter.   *   internship or master thesis applicants should provide a pdf with their cv and grade-sheets and one reference. please submit all your documents as a single pdf (with max 5 mb, otherwise will be deleted automatically) tomohsen.kaboli at bmwgroup.com<mailto:mohsen.kaboli at bmwgroup.com>. cheers mohsen ---- bmw group dr.-ing. mohsen kaboli research, new technologies, innovations research e/e architectures, technologies parkring 19 85748 garching bei m?nchen tel: +49-89-382-96049 mobile: +49-151-601-96049 mail: mohsen.kaboli at bmwgroup.com<mailto:mohsen.kaboli at bmwgroup.com> web: subject: wo fully funded ph.d. positions at the  bmw group
content: dear colleagues, two fully funded ph.d. positions (almost 2000 ? after tax per month for three years) are potentially available from 2019 in the field of robotics, artificial intelligence, and machine learning at the bmw group, the department of research, new technologies, and innovations (the artificial intelligence and cognitive services lab), in munich, germany. we seek for talented students who highly motivated to earn a research-based doctorate in areas such as   *   robot learning   *   active visio-tactile perception and learning   *   transfer learning in deep learning / reinforcement learning   *   visio-tactile navigation and path planning   *   semantic reasoning requirements for the ph.d. positions:   *   you have a master?s degree from top universities in a relevant field (e.g., robotics, computer science, engineering including e.g. electrical and mechanical engineering, statistics & optimization, math and physics).   *   you have a proven programming skills, in particular ros, c++ and/or python.   *   you have hands-on experience with frameworks such as tensorflow, pytorch, scikit-learn, opencv, etc.   *   you are fluent in english. note: your publication at one of the top international conference (icra, iros, nips, etc.,..) or high-rank journals in robotics, ai, and machine learning (tro, autonomous robots, ra-l, ijrr, ..) is a strong merit. how to apply:   *   there is no fixed deadline: the positions will be filled as soon as possible.   *   ph.d. applicants should provide at least a research statement, a pdf with their cv, degrees, and grade-sheets, and two references who are willing to write a recommendation letter. please submit all your documents as a single pdf (with max 5 mb, otherwise will be deleted automatically) to mohsen.kaboli at bmwgroup.com<mailto:mohsen.kaboli at bmwgroup.com>. ---- bmw group dr.-ing. mohsen kaboli research, new technologies, innovations research e/e architectures,
