subject: enway is looking for talented engineers
content: autonomous city services will make living in cities better and will free humans from carrying out repetitive and dangerous tasks. at enway we build the software that enables machines to do these tasks autonomously. we are starting with the software solution for autonomous sweeping - where we make sweeping much more efficient, flexible, and reliable. on this path to autonomous city services, we are working to establish autonomous sweeping in controlled private ground environments, such as factories, waste management facilities, and warehouses. we are also working on establishing autonomous sweeping in cities on public grounds. we already have commercially deployed autonomous sweeping robots at customer sites. we are integrating our technology into the series production of leading sweeper vehicle manufacturers. join us and play a critical role in our mission: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__careers.enway.ai&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=b8xe6renpoahhpq3paboyn1t11tesvs4fvjerdzbzos&s=iglbiyzjxxjrt8ygt1iocfi3xfrdum12inwl9cirkse&e= *our open positions in berlin, germany:*    - subject: professorship in machine learning at  jacobs university bremen
content: jacobs university [1] in bremen, germany is looking for a professor in  computer science in the area of machine learning (ml) [2]. the position  is initially limited to three years. jacobs university is an  international, english speaking environment. applicants should have demonstrated excellence in research and teaching.  candidates with a ml research background that is related to robotics or  automation are very welcome. the position will take over teaching  responsibility for ml in the undergraduate programs "computer science"  and "intelligent mobile systems" and in the graduate program "data  engineering". applications should be send to "job-application at jacobs-university.de"  stating the respective job id, which is provided in the job ad [2]. [1] https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.jacobs-2duniversity.de_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=pzvgzh9i_nnkcbssesb3edop9tfbmv0qdzwropimh2m&s=xiwc6zftnqkgecvarv1qh1vun-w0owj3mdoodghagyk&e= [2]  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.jacobs-2duniversity.de_interim-2dprofessor-2dcomputer-2dscience-2dmfd-2dmachine-2dlearning&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=pzvgzh9i_nnkcbssesb3edop9tfbmv0qdzwropimh2m&s=v3us8xao2-uv0cjn2gvpkpgz_afr5_peiuhdh8xgcp0&e= --  ======================================================= prof. dr. andreas birk ======================================================= jacobs university robotics group research 1, campus ring 12, 28759 bremen, germany https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics.jacobs-2duniversity.de_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=pzvgzh9i_nnkcbssesb3edop9tfbmv0qdzwropimh2m&s=79selwkzqp8vglnzjiktj0jbppgpwnabrnkyj2nu2fi&e= ======================================================= commercial registry: amtsgericht bremen, hrb 18117 president/managing director: prof. dr. michael h?lsmann chair board of governors: prof. e. j?rgen z?llner =======================================================

subject: open postdoc positions at the chair of  robotics science and systems intelligence (rsi),  technical university of munich
content: the chair of robotics science and systems intelligence (rsi) at the technical university of munich is looking for outstanding applicants for postdoc positions under supervision of prof. sami haddadin. about us located in the prosperous capital of bavaria and home to over 39000 students, the technical university of munich (tum) is one of the world?s top universities (top 4 european technical universities in the world university ranking, top 50 in shanghai ranking, top 10  in global university employability ranking, etc.). it is committed to excellence in research and teaching, interdisciplinary education, and the active promotion of promising young scientists. tum benefits from the healthy mix of companies and startups of all sizes headquartered in the region, including global corporations such as allianz, bmw, man, munich re, and siemens. the university also forges strong links with companies and scientific institutions across the world.  the chair of robotics science and systems intelligence is a member of the tum munich school of robotics and machine intelligence (msrm), founded and directed by prof. sami haddadin (2019 leibniz prize winner). the msrm is a globally visible interdisciplinary research center for machine intelligence, which is the integration of robotics, artificial intelligence and perception. its three central application focuses are the future of health, the future of work, and the future of mobility. more than 50 professors from various tum faculties cooperate within the framework of msrm. just over a year since its founding, the msrm has initiated its first major flagship initiative geriatronics, involving seven tum professors.   the goal of rsi is to significantly advance the scientific foundations for intelligent machines capable of acting autonomously in our world and in close interaction with their human creators. in order to do so, rsi bridges the gap between disciplines such as automatic control, robotics, machine learning, and human motor control.  what we offer - stimulating, high-paced environment for cutting-edge research in robotics and systems intelligence - pleasant working conditions with interesting and challenging tasks in collaboration with a talented and interdisciplinary scientific and management team - an exceptional opportunity to experience research in a highly inspiring international environment and to learn from some of the world's leading researchers  - the opportunity to develop your professional research and leadership skills in a high-impact field with excellent career opportunities description we are continuously looking for excellent postdocs to work under the supervision of prof. sami haddadin. please consider applying if you have a background in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, computer science, biomedical engineering, or a comparable field. we especially seek individuals who wish to specialize in human-centered robotics, machine learning for physical systems, modeling and control, robotics system perception, distributed intelligent systems, neuromuscular and musculoskeletal modelling, intelligent, robotic assistive devices or the like.   how to apply? the following documents are needed for applications: - a motivation letter - a detailed cv - email addresses of at least two references  interested applicants should send us the necessary documents via email to: applications at msrm.tum.de quoting ?postdoc application, chair of robotics science and systems intelligence (rsi)? in the e-mail subject line. the positions will remain open until filled and only shortlisted candidates will be notified. preference will be given to applications received before july 30th, 2019. the start date is as soon as possible, but negotiable. tum has been pursuing the strategic goal of substantially increasing the diversity of its staff. as an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, tum explicitly encourages nominations of and applications from women as well as from all others who would bring additional diversity dimensions to the university?s research and teaching strategies. preference will be given to disabled candidates with equal qualifications. international candidates are highly encouraged to apply. sincerely, ------------------------------------- saeed abdolshah, phd postdoc researcher rsi - chair of robotics science and systems intelligence munich school of robotics and machine intelligence technical university of munich he?str 134, 80797 munich email: saeed.abdolshah at tum.de phone: +49 89 289 29413 -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kgqqxp5l9k8kbwfzoiyden4hbg6canxyckl8eaz-w_k&s=4lsdrapsegtcfj9yajb_smwjukc7lmlzahkvqa028pg&e=

subject: software engineer @ dorabot inc.  atlanta, us
content: we aim to gather the smartest robot enthusiasts to build a fully autonomous robot that can see and operate in the human environment, bring a true robotic future to life. now, we are looking for a talented and experienced software engineer based in atlanta, us. *job description* 1. implement robotics algorithms 2. integrate software parts and library to the robot system 3. maintain related functions and keep it stable * position requirement* 1. skilled with linux development environment 2. focus on code style and software engineering 3. skilled with git 4. very skilled with c++, have knowledge of new standards such as c++11, c++14, etc. should be familiar with the following functions:  - pointer and smart pointer;  - memory alignment and memory management;  - stl, boost;  - oop;  - c++ template;  - linux management tools, be able to write some simple shell scripts  - toolchain and development environment setup, be able to write and modify makefile *who we are* dorabot is an ai and robotics company developing loading, sorting, induction, and transportation solutions for market-leading logistics companies in the us and asia. headquartered in shenzhen and backed by some of the most prominent tech magnates, we're a tight-knit team of visionaries that live and breathe robotics. as e-commerce has exploded, order fulfillment still largely depends on traditional resources. dorabot's advanced solutions allow express couriers to automate, keep up with increasing demand, and fully embrace the future. unique among early-stage asian startups, dorabot employs people from over 10 different countries and views diversity as a key to their success. among dorabot?s employees are former ups executives and amazon robotics challenge champions from germany and australia. dorabot is currently piloting sorting solutions in the us, which will be rolled out to additional facilities in 2019, followed by our loading and transportation systems. our website: *www.dorabot.com <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.dorabot.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=oku5ekddmnav33h937tgscsvegm7szmd9hthnm8xqik&s=y-kebiq9txsvb7lgyulutuczt_ipv3qvuvugeboqa2w&e=>* dorabot solution compilation video - *https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__youtu.be_3-2dr9gbgq-2dds&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=oku5ekddmnav33h937tgscsvegm7szmd9hthnm8xqik&s=ad72zu9ldogtfurlq652zqlhqlh0kgvzdfehar8d5is&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__youtu.be_3-2dr9gbgq-2dds&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=oku5ekddmnav33h937tgscsvegm7szmd9hthnm8xqik&s=ad72zu9ldogtfurlq652zqlhqlh0kgvzdfehar8d5is&e=>* a short video we put together showcasing our various solutions and technologies for dhl?s robotics day event in germany. life at dorabot: employee interviews: *https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.youtube.com_watch-3fv-3d57-5fvom0w-5fcy&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=oku5ekddmnav33h937tgscsvegm7szmd9hthnm8xqik&s=km00uy86g6hgfoa5nvydxvx1j2h8t2oh14vjllspwpc&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.youtube.com_watch-3fv-3d57-5fvom0w-5fcy&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=oku5ekddmnav33h937tgscsvegm7szmd9hthnm8xqik&s=km00uy86g6hgfoa5nvydxvx1j2h8t2oh14vjllspwpc&e=> subject: - kyburz opportunity - lead mechanical  engineer autonomous driving
content: position:  lead mechanical engineer autonomous driving location: freienstein, switzerland *about us* kyburz switzerland is a swiss sme with just over 100 employees based near zurich with locations in germany and australia. kyburz develops, produces, sells, and services electric vehicles for last mile delivery and niche personal mobility.  *about the job* we are looking for a dynamic engineer to lead the autonomous systems development activities at kyburz switzerland. we are developing a line of self-driving delivery vehicles for several customers and have an opening for motivated engineers of any age, gender, or religion. please see some of our previous platforms: mobile depot box: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__kyburz-2dswitzerland.ch_en_auto-5fet-5fii-5fprototype&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=fap9glrk4ph5tplqywjrhricpuhsbkylewwswbiwkma&s=dlcqzyvd_zafsp6qpdvylk3boyp-ueihpsem6nerqd8&e= autonomous delivery agent: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__kyburz-2dswitzerland.ch_en_auto-5fet-5fiii-5fprototype&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=fap9glrk4ph5tplqywjrhricpuhsbkylewwswbiwkma&s=yyvjaaikquctiqzoxwl3v3odavkohjj-xh2dg_cw1tc&e= *your responsibilities* -research and development of autonomous vehicle platforms -conception of new vehicle concepts for deployment as self-driving delivery systems -hardware specification, ideation, drawing, construction, and commissioning -testing and evaluation of hardware and software developments -leadership and planning activities in autonomous systems development --self-directed implementation and documentation of development activities --measurement of success and testing of research hypothesis *your profile* -bachelors or master?s degree in mechanical, mechatronics, or control engineering or related -specialization in vehicle engineering, mobilty, or autonomous and robotic systems -experience in the design, commissioning, and testing of robots -strong background in cad (particularly solidworks) -experience in software development (matlab/simulink, c, python) -knowledge in specifications development, including validation and verification of designs -speak and write in german and english fluently *what we offer* -opportunities to develop your skills in a future-oriented and market leading sme -an interesting and varied working environment -the opportunity to contribute to a cleaner and more sustainable transportation future are you interested in long-term prospects at an innovative company? we await your application to our motivated, energetic, friendly, and competent team, and are looking forward to meeting you! *to apply* please send all your application materials via email to: kyburz switzerland ag barbara vetsch personaladministration shedweg 2-8 8427 freienstein barbara.vetsch at kyburz-switzerland.ch www.kyburz-switzerland.ch

subject: postdoc (big data analytics / machine  learning)
content: the munich school of robotics and machine intelligence (msrm) at the technical university of munich is looking for outstanding applicants for postdoc positions under supervision of prof. sami haddadin. about us  located in the prosperous capital of bavaria and home to over 39000 students, the technical university of munich (tum) is one of the world?s top universities (top 4 european technical universities in the world university ranking, top 50 in shanghai ranking, top 10 in global university employability ranking, etc.). it is committed to excellence in research and teaching, interdisciplinary education, and the active promotion of promising young scientists. tum benefits from the healthy mix of companies and startups of all sizes headquartered in the region and is tightly connected to regional research hospitals. the university also forges strong links with companies and scientific institutions across the world. the tum munich school of robotics and machine intelligence (msrm) is founded and directed by prof. sami haddadin (2019 leibniz prize winner). the msrm is a globally visible interdisciplinary research center for machine intelligence, which is the integration of robotics, artificial intelligence and perception. its three central application focuses are the future of health, the future of work, and the future of mobility. more than 50 professors from various tum faculties cooperate within the framework of msrm. description  we are looking for excellent postdocs to build up a medical research center under the supervision of prof. haddadin and in collaboration with medical personnel, technicians, and researchers. please consider applying if you have a background in big data analytics and machine learning. we especially seek individuals who wish to specialize in medical data and applications. german language skills are not required to apply, but it is expected that speaking skills will be learned for daily interaction in a medical setting. how to apply?  the following documents are needed for applications: ? a motivation letter  ? a detailed cv  ? email addresses of at least two references  interested applicants should send us the necessary documents via email to: applications at msrm.tum.de quoting ?postdoc application, h? in the e-mail subject line. the positions will be filled as soon as possible and only shortlisted candidates will be notified. preference will be given to applications received before june 15th, 2019. tum has been pursuing the strategic goal of substantially increasing the diversity of its staff. as an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, tum explicitly encourages nominations of and applications from women as well as from all others who would bring additional diversity dimensions to the university?s research and teaching strategies. preference will be given to disabled candidates with equal qualifications. international candidates are highly encouraged to apply. sincerely, ------------------------- saeed abdolshah, phd postdoc researcher technische universit?t m?nchen  munich school of robotics and machine intelligence  he?stra?e 134  80797 m?nchen  email: saeed.abdolshah at tum.de phone: +49 89 289 29413 -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=9yxg3ayca0xea4ivj4rwpki9hfqhhzfbiiegt441ge4&s=blsrqb5nuy9wzmojo939lw530i-h-sgpqljgqt40hi0&e=

subject: multiple robot and a.i. project  internship positions at smst (xi'an, china)
content: the school of marine science and technology (smst, a department of northwestern polytechnical university, xi?an, china) is focused on the scientific research and talents cultivation in marine information processing, underwater vehicle, marine engineering fields. now smst is looking for a highly motivated intern to work on developing algorithms for robot control, deep reinforcement learning and swarm intelligence. successful candidate will collaborate with smst researchers to design, analyze, and implement new algorithms, conduct experiments, and prepare results for publication. the candidate should have a strong background in data fusion, machine learning and robotics. prior experience of working with robotic systems is required. the candidate should be comfortable implementing the developed algorithms in python and should have prior experience working with ros. prior exposure to deep learning and hands-on experience with packages such as pytorch and/or tensorflow is expected. the candidate is expected to be a master/phd student in computer science, electrical engineering, operations research, statistics, applied mathematics, or a related field, with relevant publication record. expected duration of the internship is at least 3 months. the position is expected to be available starting late july. interested candidates are encouraged to apply with their recent cv with list of related publications and links to github repositories (if any). we can afford:1.      living expenses.2.      accommodation fees.3.      international trip costs.  if you have questions, please contact me at feihu.zhang at nwpu.edu.cn or feihu.zhang at tum.de   -- asso. prof. dr. feihu zhang school of marine science and technology northwestern polytechnical university 127?youyi west road?xi'an?shaanxxi?china

subject: multiple postdoctoral positions  available at smst (xi'an, china)
content: the school of marine science and technology (smst, a department of northwestern polytechnical university, xi?an, china) is focused on the scientific research and talents cultivation in marine information processing, underwater vehicle, marine engineering fields. smst warmly welcomes overseas researchers to apply postdoctoral positions in robotics and a.i., navigation, image processing& recognizing and other related disciplines. notice that the positions would start as soon as possible. salary will be competitive, commensurate with qualifications and experience.successful candidate will collaborate with smst researchers to design, analyze, and implement new algorithms, conduct experiments, and prepare results for publication. the candidate should have a strong background in data fusion, machine learning and robotics domains. the position would be guaranteed for at least two year, with possible for one year extension.apply, the following documents are needed for applications:  - a motivation letter  - a detailed cv  - email addresses of at least two references    if you have questions, please contact me at feihu.zhang at nwpu.edu.cn or feihu.zhang at tum.de   -- asso. prof. dr. feihu zhang school of marine science and technology northwestern polytechnical university 127?youyi west road?xi'an?shaanxxi?china

subject: ph.d. position at the humanoid robots  lab in bonn, germany
content: open phd position at the university of bonn ========================================== the humanoid robots lab at the university of bonn in germany, headed by maren bennewitz, is seeking for a qualified and highly motivated phd student in the area of motion planning and visual perception for robots operating in human environments.  about the candidate candidates for phd positions must hold a very good master's degree in computer science or a related field. solid programming skills in c++ and expertise in working with real robotic systems are expected. the candidate will also be involved in teaching activities in courses on robotics. very good knowledge of english is a prerequisite, the knowledge of the german language is welcome but not a formal requirement. high interpersonal skills are a big plus. how to apply qualified applicants holding a master's degree should provide the following material: 1) cover letter briefly describing background and research interests, relevant experience (studies, technical projects, internships, etc.) 2) programming experience and languages (c++, python, ros, etc.) 3) cv and a transcript of records 4) date of availability 5) names and contact information for two reference letters all documents should be submitted by june 30 via email as a single pdf file smaller than 10 mb to jobs19hrl at cs.uni-bonn.de. about the humanoid robots lab the humanoid robots lab concentrates on robots acting in human environments. we develop techniques that allow robots to adapt their behavior to the environment and to the surrounding people thereby exploiting semantic information about objects and information about the activities of users. we have introduced several novel methods for environment modeling as well as for planning navigation and manipulation actions for wheeled and biped robots. among them are techniques for 3d environment perception and exploration, footstep planning, constrained manipulation planning, human-aware navigation, and imitation of human whole-body motions. currently, we especially focus on motion planning and navigation through cluttered and dynamic scenes as well as on generating foresighted robot behavior by predicting human motions over a longer time horizon. the humanoid robots lab has been participating in various national and international projects funded by the german research foundation and the european commission.  about bonn bonn is a city on the banks of the river rhine in the german state of north rhine-westphalia with a population of 320,000 (of which 38,000 are students). the city has been founded in the first century bc as a roman settlement and it is one of germany's oldest cities. bonn has an oceanic climate and due to its location few kilometers south of the cologne basin valley, it belongs to one of germany's warmest regions along the rhine. bonn is located around 25 km south of cologne. a visual impression of bonn can be found here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__upload.wikimedia.org_wikipedia_commons_2_24_general-5fview-5fover-5fbonn.jpg&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wb89hinl_dhwzut9sry7ctcfxaxbvnwodd65j90fx30&s=xzibytfftgxzjqaz0tq3tbjqv5upzvify8qha-4mgo4&e= salary the position will be payed according to the german tvl e13 payment scheme (between 46,000 euro p.a. and 52,000 euro p.a. before tax, depending on experience). relevant links: * humanoid robots lab: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.hrl.uni-2dbonn.de_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wb89hinl_dhwzut9sry7ctcfxaxbvnwodd65j90fx30&s=0c-qmgbrnkplgi-rc-cuqpcg4l6gujaqx5as5ip4k6e&e= * university of bonn: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.uni-2dbonn.de&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wb89hinl_dhwzut9sry7ctcfxaxbvnwodd65j90fx30&s=dfzksftbhs7lr_xhqkehhsdwdip8rrvyltpydnkjrls&e= * bonn, germany: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__en.wikipedia.org_wiki_bonn&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wb89hinl_dhwzut9sry7ctcfxaxbvnwodd65j90fx30&s=3gpqimylurm_jfzo3sws4qdq8jsojoseodxwpnrnuks&e= subject: phd and postdoc positions available for  h2020 european project in france
content: where : institut pascal, clermont-ferrand, france | france  project name : softmanbot (advanced robotic technology for handling soft materials in manufacturing sectors).  beginning date: 1st october 2019.  duration: 3 years for phd and 2 (+1 possible) years for postdoc.  requirements: master on robotics/computer vision (for phd) or phd on robotics/computer vision (for postdoc)  key words : computer vision, machine learning, robot control and programming  project: softmanbot is an industrial research project that will provide an innovative robotic system for handling flexible and deformable materials within labor-intensive production processes. the system will be composed by three main pillars: generic robotic perception (perception of the product and the human operator), a multi-sensor control and planning platform (advanced control algorithms for shape and contact servoing and ai-based task generalization) and smart dexterous grippers (smart mechanical design which will embody grasping/manipulation skills and integrate sensors, mainly tactile) able to handle soft components with high-levels of robustness and flexibility. special attention will be paid to the integration of novel robotic concepts based on aspects of safety, ergonomics, adaptability, acceptance and user experience. industrially relevant pilot demonstrators will be implemented for four key manufacturing sectors: toys, textile, footwear and tyres.  working context: the scientific excellence and international dimensions of the work will be essential. the retained candidates will work in an international team of academic and industrial partners from 4 different european countries ( spain , france, italy and germany). they will travel to all these countries for the consortium meetings and participate in top international robotic/vision conferences. they will work very closely with engineers from the innovation services of michelin in order to integrate real demonstrators with mobile manipulators for tyre assembly.  application: the interested candidates should send their cvs and 2 reference contacts as a single pdf file to: youcef.mezouar at sigma-clermont.fr, erol.ozgur at sigma-clermont.fr and juan.corrales at sigma-clermont.fr with [softmanbot application] as email subject.  ===  prof. youcef mezouar  sigma clermont  www.sigma-clermont.fr  head of the machines, mechanisms and systems department  ===  institut pascal umr 6602 cnrs/uca/sigma clermont  head of the maccs research team  ===  professor  sigma clermont  www.sigma-clermont.fr  head of the machines, mechanisms and systems department  ===  institut pascal umr 6602 cnrs/uca/sigma clermont  head of the maccs research team

subject: post doc position in exosuits design at  heidelberg university
content: *postdoc position available in soft exoskeletons at heidelberg university (germany)*  we seek for motivated researches to work on a multidisciplinary project merging two main expertise in robotics and smart clothing design with special target on clinical application and human augmentation for industry.   the goal is to continue the program on wearable exoskeletons for human assistance/augmentation, improving the generation of actuators based on tendon driven transmission integrated in the textiles and implementing new model based controllers. *information on the research topics and research streams can be found here:*  www.lorenzomasia.com  the candidate will be enrolled in a vibrant and multidisciplinary environment and she/he will be asked to join the team working on the project by providing inputs and improvements in the design and characterization of the devices, for both the technological counterpart and the research related to smart wearable textiles.  *your profile*: we are looking for excellent applicants with a phd degree in mechanical engineering, robotics, computer science, applied mathematics, materials science or physics, who are motivated to carry out internationally leading research.  *knowledge in one or more of the following topics is mandatory*: robotics and control design, computer-aided design (cad), biomechanics and model based control, applied computing and applied artificial intelligence.  *what we are offering*: a 3 years (extendable) post doc position fully funded with a competitive salary (e13 position 100%). you will be part of a highly motivated, international team at one of the most competitive universities in europe and in the world. besides working in our growing, ambitious team you will also have the chance to collaborate with numerous team across the world, clinical institutions, other labs and industrial partners co-funding the project. *intakes*: starting date from september 2019.  *how to apply*: please contact at first prof lorenzo masia for further info by email (*lormasia at gmail.com*), mentioning your background and stating your motivation in no more than 10 lines, and including a short cv with academic record, contact reference and publication records.  only selected applicants will be contacted for a skype or onsite interview.  ----- lorenzo masia phd full professor  institute of computer engineering heidelberg university germany adjunct associate professor faculty of engineering southern denmark university (sdu) -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwicag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=xlrihkxl46kmpq5ggkggfmczbycvlyb-yldctziw-zo&s=yaa8kacpsauwkz-68xsagdz8cd54knr27eh-bdjuez0&e=

subject: enway is looking for talented engineers
content: autonomous city services will make living in cities better and will free humans from carrying out repetitive and dangerous tasks. at enway we build the software that enables machines to do these tasks autonomously. we are starting with the software solution for autonomous sweeping - where we make sweeping much more efficient, flexible, and reliable. on this path to autonomous city services, we are working to establish autonomous sweeping in controlled private ground environments, such as factories, waste management facilities, and warehouses. we are also working on establishing autonomous sweeping in cities on public grounds. we already have commercially deployed autonomous sweeping robots at customer sites. we are integrating our technology into the series production of leading sweeper vehicle manufacturers. join us and play a critical role in our mission: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__careers.enway.ai&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_prsmi_pj1gd5vqvcfjxxsve_lckci3l_8ecv4jca9m&s=w9xw1dfjehd34tfdbwhtvlhae1rb3bzcjvwer9w7zrc&e=  *our open positions in berlin, germany:*    - field deployment engineer (f/m/d):    https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__careers.enway.ai_o_field-2ddeployment-2dengineer-2dfmd&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_prsmi_pj1gd5vqvcfjxxsve_lckci3l_8ecv4jca9m&s=cjate2my8d30uux_c9xnofxhgzrdyonaywrvexcd8qg&e=     - robotics hardware & electrical engineering lead (f/m/d):    https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__careers.enway.ai_o_robotics-2dhardware-2delectrical-2dengineering-2dlead-2dfmd&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_prsmi_pj1gd5vqvcfjxxsve_lckci3l_8ecv4jca9m&s=mlgloxhssfsa8eqfazhx-glllo43zvvfp2ufktpvxzi&e=     - general robotics engineer (f/m/d):    https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__careers.enway.ai_o_general-2drobotics-2dengineer-2dfmd&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_prsmi_pj1gd5vqvcfjxxsve_lckci3l_8ecv4jca9m&s=uytyrnryziytuhk3yffw0pit1onqhy3ydze86flb3jk&e=  *our open positions in singapore:*    - general robotics engineer (f/m/d):    https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__careers.enway.ai_o_general-2drobotics-2dengineer-2dfmd-2d1&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_prsmi_pj1gd5vqvcfjxxsve_lckci3l_8ecv4jca9m&s=upu6xz6_05g3ex7mytejpf5hz8pr46wxdc54rfpvpe0&e=

subject: postdoctoral scholar openings at oregon  state university
content: oregon state university has multiple openings for postdocs in the labs of prof. geoff hollinger, prof. kagan tumer, prof. julie a. adams, prof. fuxin li, and prof. joe davidson. the initial appointments will be for one year and are renewable yearly by mutual agreement. successful candidates will be hired as postdoctoral scholars and governed by the appropriate terms and conditions ( https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__gradschool.oregonstate.edu_postdocs_appointment-2dand-2drecruitment&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=unfeihquq6mipttpinitqaqb0uorisclmwj6mbw2v-8&s=h09n018549k2d8kiutsxeuorsceefqnal0xmhx5m_yi&e= ). the successful candidate will have (or will be expected to earn prior to start date) a ph.d. in robotics, computer science, engineering, or a related field and expertise in one of the following areas: -planning, coordination, perception, and learning for autonomous underwater vehicles and/or unmanned aerial vehicles. algorithm design and theoretical analysis applied to robotic systems operating in harsh, unstructured environments. autonomous underwater docking and underwater manipulation applications are of particular interest. -reinforcement learning, evolutionary algorithms, and multiagent systems. applying machine learning algorithms to real world problems, including sensor coordination, uav coordination, multi-robot coordination, and advanced power plant control. the successful candidate will take a leadership role in coordinating collaborations across the collaborative robotics and intelligent systems (coris) institute at oregon state university (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics.oregonstate.edu_&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=unfeihquq6mipttpinitqaqb0uorisclmwj6mbw2v-8&s=7xmlz_qbpxjbv82gjsjagvb6rpsxsmvjikjsosmslhm&e= ) and with external collaborators in academia, government, and industry. the coris institute at osu is growing rapidly, now with more than 35 affiliated faculty, and we are looking for motivated, talented individuals to join our team. to apply, email a single file (no more than 2 mb) containing your cv and a one page summary of research interests to: geoff.hollinger at oregonstate.edu with a subject line: postdoc application: lastname, firstname positions are available with a possible option of starting in fall 2019 or at a later negotiated date. applications will be reviewed as they are received. early applicants should indicate if they will be at rss in freiburg, germany for a possible meeting with osu faculty. --  geoffrey a. hollinger assistant professor collaborative robotics and intelligent systems (coris) institute school of mechanical, industrial & manufacturing engineering oregon state university corvallis, or 97331 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__research.engr.oregonstate.edu_rdml_&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=unfeihquq6mipttpinitqaqb0uorisclmwj6mbw2v-8&s=hx2l8d2ldrfu38fjb5pggrkmvsgmivcuxog2z9ht720&e=  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__coris.oregonstate.edu&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=unfeihquq6mipttpinitqaqb0uorisclmwj6mbw2v-8&s=n_ikvtzs4qb_5ilq_uk5ykveeuhldvlhwpctkbtp1jy&e=

subject: enway is looking for a robotics  hardware lead
content: autonomous city services will make living in cities better and will free humans from carrying out repetitive and dangerous tasks. at enway we drive the path to autonomous city services by equipping hardware 'made in germany', with the software that enables machines to do such tasks autonomously. for now, our solutions focus on autonomous sweeping - where we make sweeping much more efficient, flexible, and reliable. we have already successfully deployed autonomous sweeping robots in controlled private ground environments at various customer sites throughout germany and are also partnering with the city of singapore to introduce autonomous sweeping to public places. we provide a robotic system that is reliable, high quality, safe, and user-friendly. enway is now looking for a robotics hardware lead who will work at the intersection of hardware and software and will lead the integration of our technology into the serial production of leading sweeper vehicle manufacturers. join a rapidly growing deep-tech startup in berlin with a highly motivated, result-oriented, international, world-class team by applying here today: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__careers.enway.ai_o_robotics-2dhardware-2dlead-2dfmd&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nvn2gqk5r1g4kndq_kwwyyesguyjy8uqxccmg-bt-s0&s=xqkmox-7nbntpunpccvn6d4lnifuflghyx3nnj5dlwi&e=  *about the role*    - you will be responsible for all hardware and electronics related    innovation and developments in the context of retrofitting our vehicles    - you will own the ramp-up and transition of our production to a    manufacturer in the context of our efforts to move to serial production    - you will manage a team of talented, dedicated and highly motivated    hardware and electronics engineers    - you will own our relations with key hardware vendors and suppliers    - you will have a hand in nearly every component of a sophisticated    autonomous system and will be responsible for its ce certification *our offer*    - flexible working hours    - employee stock participation    - highly competitive salary    - lunch, fitness, laptop and other perks    - vibrant and innovative working environment    - flat hierarchies and freedom to express and implement your idea *job requirements*    - university degree in mechanical engineering, mechatronics, electrical    engineering, robotics or similar    - extensive experiences in mechanical cad and designing electrical    systems    - interdisciplinary knowledge (mechanics, electronics, embedded    software) of and extensive experience in building mechatronic systems    - working experience with hardware products involving material science &    manufacturing, digital & analog electronics, micro controllers & sensors    - fluency in english and german    - a strategic mind paired with a hands-on attitude (drilling, soldering,    crimping, etc.)    - experience with regards to electrical safety standards (emi, esd, ce)    - team management experience as well as ramp up experience with robotics    systems would be idea    - willingness to relocate to berlin

subject: technical support in robotics lab
content: the robotics and biology lab at the technical university berlin is currently looking for someone to fill this position: technical support employee - salary grade e11 tv-l berliner hochschulen closing date for applications: 05/07/19 for more information, visit: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__stellenticket.de_65873_-3flang-3den&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ls5p0uooqqqe9c4nw1ndr5p1vrhkf0lutnr-hmdclpc&s=pewbkmnuytjamyasqyxmnuiybw-tadaqcb9tzpgjo5u&e=  and https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.robotics.tu-2dberlin.de_menue_open-5fpositions_parameter_en_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ls5p0uooqqqe9c4nw1ndr5p1vrhkf0lutnr-hmdclpc&s=j8cacpu1gushyb4fuksaurfty3av3py-rue86_uy1ii&e=  work?ing field: deve?lop?ment of com?plex mecha?tro?nic sys?tems; con?cep?tion, con?struc?tion, imple?men?ta?tion and eva?lua?tion of expe?ri?ments with rese?arch robots; crea?tion of cir?cuit and prin?ted cir?cuit board designs; setup and pro?gramming of micro?con?trol?lers; con?cep?tual plan?ning and tech?ni?cal com?pi?la?tion of labo?ra?to?ries and expe?ri?men?tal set-ups; design and pro?duc?tion of 3d-prin?ted parts; imple?men?ta?tion of safety regu?la?ti?ons; inter?face to the infra?st?ruc?ture of the excel?lence clus?ter science of intelligence require?ments: tech?nical edu?ca?tion (suc?cess?fully com?pleted degree qual?i?fy?ing for entry into the upper grade of civil ser?vice resp. into the equi?val?ent level of qual?i?fic?a?tion [fh-dip?lom, bsc in the fields of com?puter sci?ence or com?puter engin?eer?ing]) or employ?ees with equal abil?it?ies and long?stand?ing exper?i?ence; abil?ity and exper?i?ence in work?ing with and the devel?op?ment of mechat?ronic sys?tems (robot?ics, elec?tron?ics, mech?an?ics); very good pro?gram?ming skills in the lan?guages c++, java, python, php; good know?ledge of cms sys?tems; know?ledge of cad is an advant?age; very good ger?man and eng?lish skills required how to ap?ply: please send your applic?a?tion with the ref?er?ence num?ber iv-367/19 and the usual doc?u?ments prefer?ably by email in a single pdf file with a max. size of 10 mb to robotics at robotics.tu-berlin.de<mailto:robotics at robotics.tu-berlin.de> or in writ?ing to tech?nis?che uni?versit?t ber?lin - der pr?sid?ent - fak?ult?t iv, insti?tut f?r tech?nis?che inform?atik und mik?roelektronik, fg robot?ics and bio?logy labor?at?ory, prof. dr. brock, sekr. mar 5-1, march?stra?e 23, 10587 ber?lin. to ensure equal oppor?tun?it?ies between women and men, applic?a?tions by women with the required qual?i?fic?a?tions are expli?citly desired. qual?i?fied indi?vidu?als with dis?ab?il?it?ies will be favored. the tu ber?lin val?ues the diversity of its mem?bers and is com?mit?ted to the goals of equal oppor?tun?it?ies. please send cop?ies only. ori?ginal doc?u?ments will not be returned. kind regards, elizabeth ball technische universit?t berlin dept. of computer engineering and microelectronics robotics and biology laboratory marchstr. 23<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__maps.google.com_-3fq-3dmarchstr.-2b23-26entry-3dgmail-26source-3dg&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ls5p0uooqqqe9c4nw1ndr5p1vrhkf0lutnr-hmdclpc&s=m5mkl_d5x1xutatnbb1b_u6aaoh4upvdtrbczjqaizg&e= > / mar 5-1 10587 berlin germany phone: +49 (0)30 314-73110<tel:+49%2030%2031473110> fax: +49 (0)30 314-21 116<tel:+49%2030%2031421116> www.robotics.tu-berlin.de<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.robotics.tu-2dberlin.de_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ls5p0uooqqqe9c4nw1ndr5p1vrhkf0lutnr-hmdclpc&s=2hlemhbuu7ierl6brmkvahqukp3ylkwzuzz3fzifcie&e= >

subject: ph.d. positions at ntnu in taiwan
content: phd student positions application deadline: 15th july 2019 program start date: 1st september 2019 overview the educational robotics center at national taiwan normal university has openings for three ph.d. students in the areas of intelligent robotics, such as    1.    programming by demonstration    2.    explainable ai for self-driving cars    3.    humanoid robot athletes the positions are funded through full scholarships from national taiwan normal university (ntnu) and the taiwanese ministry for science and technology (most). the scholarship includes a stipend of $40,000 ntd per month. requirements potential candidates must have a strong academic background including successful completion of a thesis-based m.sc. or similar degree at an accredited university. candidates must have demonstrated academic aptitude through previous publications including academic papers,  thesis, or project reports. previous experience in large projects or participation at the federation of international robot sports association <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.firaworldcup.org&d=dwmfaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=oztfnn5evegrab9upcdrfi9xamlpkmnxt-2s4hqlwoq&s=nt_tg1zt4oa5qnzwsf6mvtjsrab1mkefkczr52cores&e=> (fira) or robocup <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.robocup.org&d=dwmfaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=oztfnn5evegrab9upcdrfi9xamlpkmnxt-2s4hqlwoq&s=a-rbqvdn0tudmszj9y8rlyuvzxguqxd7dyqv7k_0nru&e=> robot competitions is a plus. all candidates must possess strong practical skills in the areas of general programming, especially using ros <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ros.org&d=dwmfaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=oztfnn5evegrab9upcdrfi9xamlpkmnxt-2s4hqlwoq&s=9wjs637bfxjuuwk-y-gugwovjnvrst0uymtm6ejwm80&e=> . educational robotics center the educational robotics center (erc) at ntnu is guided by prof. jacky baltes <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__scholar.google.com.tw_citations-3fuser-3d557qr3kaaaaj-26hl-3den&d=dwmfaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=oztfnn5evegrab9upcdrfi9xamlpkmnxt-2s4hqlwoq&s=0tnjcuq4p7mrtza-yhgpxcgsbm3cejkqfkqvewez9ji&e=>. the research group focuses on the development of robot athletes for various sports. prof. baltes? team is an experienced team and has successfully competed at various robot competitions. the erc is an international research lab, which currently includes about 20 researchers from brazil, canada, germany, india, indonesia, iran, south korea, taiwan, thailand, and   vietnam  . courses and research are conducted in english. the erc maintains collaborations with many other research labs world-wide. national taiwan normal university the national taiwan normal university is one of the best universities in taiwan and has a world class reputation (22nd in qs university world ranking <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__en.ntnu.edu.tw_news-2dshow.php-3fid-3d11955&d=dwmfaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=oztfnn5evegrab9upcdrfi9xamlpkmnxt-2s4hqlwoq&s=8o0igysgrt17w2qsqbmtcrnd2z8juidfbzy7ou2aguu&e=>) in education. it was initially a teachers? college (hence normal university), but has expanded in recent years to be a full university including colleges for science, engineering, arts, and humanities. ntnu has approximately 17,000 students with about 1,800 foreign students. ntnu is also the host of the mandarin chinese teaching center, one of the best schools for learning mandarin chinese. the main campus of ntnu, where erc is located, is in the da?an district of taipei. taiwan. taipei is a modern and vibrant city with great food and an exciting environment that combines asian and western culture. taiwan is also the main manufacturing hub for advanced electronics and includes headquarters of many multinational technology powerhouses such as nvidia, google, microsoft, mediatek, asus, acer, foxconn, garmin, and giant. application procedure to apply for one of these positions or for further information about the erc, please contact prof. jacky baltes via email jacky.baltes at ntnu.edu.tw before the deadline 15th july 2019. --  prof. jacky baltes, skype, twitter, telegram: jacky.baltes national taiwan normal university 162 heping e. rd., sec. 1, taipei 10610, taiwan tel: +886 -2-7734-3634 email: jacky.baltes at ntnu.edu.tw

subject: underwater computer vision engineer  (w/m/d) at kraken robotik in germany
content: kraken robotik gmbh in bremen/germany is a sme working in the are of underwater sensing and robotics. we are looking for software engineers (junior/senior) with an interest in computer vision, robotics and underwater technology.  candates should provide these technical skills: 	? image processing 	? state estimation 	? pointcloud processing 	? development c++, c and ruby 	? linux system administration we offer an exciting environment with a strong international orientation in the innovative field of robotics and ai in underwater technology. flexible working conditions with opportunities in germany (bremen, munich) or canada (st. john?s, halifax) interested? write us an email information on the job listing can be found here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_krg-2dcveng-2d31fc&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=bz4moejibexgu-p8ctigglfgpb9j0p4bsggglnhisro&s=4-r3snbojszzxdvuexiiotpdbb5yz9owffvzyutu_ci&e=  --  dr. jan christian albiez director of engineering kraken robotik gmbh   fon: +49-(0)421 40894664 fax: +49-(0)421 40894669 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.krakenrobotik.de&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=bz4moejibexgu-p8ctigglfgpb9j0p4bsggglnhisro&s=05zftvaloshlulpkgx4rb70n2bjnjsqhhomg0ljk5zi&e=    register: district court bremen hrb 32040 managing directors: dr. jakob schwendner, greg reid

subject: 3+ year postdoc opportunity  (geometric+radiometric underwater vision+slam), geomar kiel, germany
content: dear colleagues, the *oceanic machine vision group* at geomar kiel, germany, offers a  fully funded postdoc position (until 05/2022, possibly longer) in the  context of robust underwater visual mapping, slam for autonomous robots,  camera (auto-)calibration and deep sea vision with challenging lighting  conditions. you have a phd in machine vision or visual robotics and practical  experience in use and calibration of cameras ? you are interested in  connecting geometric and radiometric models for underwater vision and to  develop theoretically well-founded solutions for challenging and  exciting real world problems ? then you have found the right location. geomar helmholtz centre for ocean research kiel is one of germany's  public large research facilities and among the internationally leading  institutes in the field of marine sciences, operating in all oceans and  water depths worldwide. the goal of the oceanic machine vision group is  to bring machine vision to the deep sea with challenging localization,  lighting and visibility conditions. for more details with respect to the  application process, please visit https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.geomar.de_en_service_karriere_job-2dsingle_article_postdoc-2dmwd-2dfuer-2dmaschinelles-2dsehen-2dunter-2dwasser_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hwakyk3vfzbaozdg9ensnpv4fi591dnapa7z1xujuxc&s=u-okgiyag-p1-scfvlp-lwj4hdmrait00jgav9unaiu&e=  or contact me if you have any questions. looking forward to your  application, kevin k?ser --  dr. kevin k?ser oceanic machine vision geomar helmholtz centre for ocean research kiel wischhofstrasse 1-3, 24148 kiel, germany ++49 431 600 2566,  office: building 8a, room 210 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.geomar.de_-7ekkoeser-2de&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hwakyk3vfzbaozdg9ensnpv4fi591dnapa7z1xujuxc&s=5okqeydcpqbbaitad8qvvoydtwaooihfeupwu069v0g&e=

subject: senior computer vision engineer/ lead  computer vision engineer- dorabot inc.
content: dorabot is expanding and hiring for new positions! join us in revolutionizing  robotics by applying cutting-edge technology to real world scenarios.  *senior computer vision engineer/ lead computer vision engineer*  1. work with both 2d (rgb) and 3d (depth) raw perception data. 2. solve vision tasks including but not limited to the following: - vision sensor calibration (internal and external) - identifying and classifying objects, generating bounding boxes, segmenting objects, and generating object masks - measuring object sizes - estimating and tracking object poses - learning/scanning new objects quickly with surface reconstruction - identifying and reading barcodes - large-scale automatic data collection - efficient and autonomous data labeling - vision-based mapping, localization, and navigation 3. program robots to perform the tasks listed above in various lighting conditions, with heavy occlusion, while robots/cameras are moving at high speeds. 4. the job might involve researching particular topics, reading papers, attending conferences, efficiently implementing algorithms for hardware, testing, debugging, parallelization, sourcing sensors and computing platforms, writing documents/papers, and generating patents. position requirements	 1. background in computer vision, computer graphics, image processing, machine learning or other related fields, phd is preferred 2. very skilled in c++ and python (knowledge and daily experience) 3. solid knowledge of computer vision with experience of turning theories into practical programs. 4. very skilled with vision libraries: opencv, pcl, etc. 5. very skilled with deep learning frameworks: tensor flow, keras, etc. 6. skilled with machine learning techniques, especially deep learning, reinforcement learning, and transfer learning. preferred qualifications	 1. published author in computer vision and graphics journals and attended conferences such as cvpr, iccv, siggraph, etc. 2. experienced in programming, robotics, or vision algorithm challenges, e.g. ilsvrc 3. strong experience in any of the following areas: - image detection and segmentation - scene comprehension - image captioning - video analysis - multi-object pose estimation - rgb-d segmentation - 3d reconstruction - motion tracking - large-scale datasets creation - multi-cluster gpu training - open source project collaboration - blogging/writing about computer vision or robotics here?s a bit about our company:  dorabot is an ai and robotics company developing loading, sorting,  induction, and  transportation solutions for market-leading logistics companies in the us  and china. headquartered in shenzhen and backed by some of china's most  prominent tech magnates, we're a tight-knit team of visionaries that live  and breathe robotics.  as e-commerce has exploded, order fulfillment still largely depends on  traditional  resources. dorabot's advanced solutions allow express couriers to automate,  keep up with increasing demand, and fully embrace the future.  unique among early-stage chinese startups, dorabot employs people from over  10  different countries and views diversity as a key to their success. among  dorabot?s  employees are former ups executives and amazon robotics challenge champions  from germany and australia.  dorabot is currently piloting sorting solutions in the us, which will be  rolled out to  additional facilities in 2019, followed by our loading and transportation  systems.  our website: www.dorabot.com  what we offer:  -a competitive salary and company equity based on experience and personal  contributions  -an amazing opportunity to experience life in shenzhen, widely known as  china?s silicon valley. shenzhen has the best air quality of any major city  in china!  -free chinese lessons  -free lunches and fresh fruit  -an international workplace where english is our working language  -on-site company gym  -plenty of resources to purchase all kinds of equipment for research and  development  *dorabot videos:*  dorabot solution compilation video - https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__youtu.be_3-2dr9gbgq-2dds&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kgrhwodzsadebg_kjfkvzm0ph6tuzffhnjj6b0d6v9a&s=x1fxg1pf-nscyxcv5drv7ffyhza6uhtpxlzp7iitv_g&e= a short video we put together showcasing our various solutions and  technologies for dhl?s robotics day event in germany.  dorabot rewind 2018: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.youtube.com_watch-3fv-3dzop88u-2dnrlk&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kgrhwodzsadebg_kjfkvzm0ph6tuzffhnjj6b0d6v9a&s=l9nev45wmqclayxab0gwqsu3x_6ktowocav2awbqjae&e= -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=m66anz4mku4chnz1-abwjuqwgfqqftcjmyjoxd7qvf4&s=liwum7pvrxgpump-sdagrr-jsyjkpedpzmikg9nok0g&e=

subject: open postdoc positions at the chair of  robotics science and systems intelligence (rsi),  technical university of munich
content: *about us  *located in the prosperous capital of bavaria and home to over 39000 students, the technical university of munich (tum) is one of the world?s top universities (top 4 european technical universities in the world university ranking, top 50 in shanghai ranking, top 10 in global university employability ranking, etc.) and home to one of the most vibrant environments in robotics. it is committed to excellence in research and teaching, interdisciplinary education, and the active promotion of promising young scientists. tum benefits from the healthy mix of companies and startups of all sizes headquartered in the region and is tightly connected to regional research hospitals. the university also forges strong links with companies and scientific institutions across the world. the chair of robotics science and systems intelligence (rsi) is a member of the tum munich school of robotics and machine intelligence (msrm), directed by prof. sami haddadin. the msrm is a globally visible interdisciplinary research center for machine intelligence, which is the integration of robotics, artificial intelligence and perception. its three central innovation sectors are the future of health, the future of work, and the future of mobility. more than 50 professors from various tum faculties cooperate within the framework of msrm. the research focus of rsi is the development of control algorithms, mechatronics, intelligent robotics and prosthetics, robot learning algorithms, foundations of machine intelligence, as well as nonlinear control and systems theory. furthermore, we offer unified teaching in terms of lectures, laboratories and student projects with a tight connection to cutting-edge research. *what we offer  *- stimulating, high-paced environment for cutting-edge research in robotics and systems intelligence - pleasant working conditions with interesting and challenging tasks in collaboration with a talented and interdisciplinary scientific and management team - an exceptional opportunity to experience research in a highly inspiring international environment and to learn from some of the world's leading researchers  - the opportunity to develop your professional research and leadership skills in a high-impact field with excellent career opportunities *description * we are continuously looking for excellent postdocs to work under the supervision of prof. sami haddadin. please consider applying if you have a background in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, computer science, biomedical engineering, or a comparable field. we especially seek individuals who wish to specialize in human-centered robotics, machine learning for physical systems, modeling and control, robotics system perception, distributed intelligent systems, neuromuscular and musculoskeletal modelling, intelligent, robotic assistive devices or the like. *how to apply?  *the following documents are needed for applications: - a motivation letter - a detailed cv - email addresses of at least two references  interested applicants should send us the necessary documents via email to: applications at msrm.tum.de quoting ?postdoc application, chair of robotics science and systems intelligence (rsi)? in the e-mail subject line. the positions will remain open until filled and only shortlisted candidates will be notified. preference will be given to applications received before august 31st, 2019. the start date is as soon as possible, but negotiable. tum has been pursuing the strategic goal of substantially increasing the diversity of its staff. as an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, tum explicitly encourages nominations of and applications from women as well as from all others who would bring additional diversity dimensions to the university?s research and teaching strategies. preference will be given to disabled candidates with equal qualifications. international candidates are highly encouraged to apply. sincerely, ------------------------------------- saeed abdolshah, phd postdoc researcher rsi - chair of robotics science and systems intelligence munich school of robotics and machine intelligence technical university of munich he?str 134, 80797 munich email: saeed.abdolshah at tum.de phone: +49 89 289 29413 -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=iftev587lepz4siqrfbtw9x2m7wurknntzv70elu_mk&s=g2akrvirj8cminzt3yaa6zkgs1ozgen1szj3kbzrldi&e=

subject: postdoc (big data analytics / machine  learning),  the munich school of robotics and machine intelligence at the technical  university of munich
content: *about us * located in the prosperous capital of bavaria and home to over 39000 students, the technical university of munich (tum) is one of the world?s top universities (top 4 european technical universities in the world university ranking, top 50 in shanghai ranking, top 10 in global university employability ranking, etc.) and home to one of the most vibrant environments in robotics. it is committed to excellence in research and teaching, interdisciplinary education, and the active promotion of promising young scientists. tum benefits from the healthy mix of companies and startups of all sizes headquartered in the region and is tightly connected to regional research hospitals. the university also forges strong links with companies and scientific institutions across the world.  the tum munich school of robotics and machine intelligence (msrm) is directed by prof. sami haddadin. the msrm is a globally visible interdisciplinary research center for machine intelligence, which is the integration of robotics, artificial intelligence and perception. its three central innovation sectors are the future of health, the future of work, and the future of mobility. more than 50 professors from various tum faculties cooperate within the framework of msrm.  * description * we are looking for excellent postdocs to build up a medical research center under the supervision of prof. haddadin and in collaboration with medical personnel, technicians, and researchers. please consider applying if you have a background in big data analytics and machine learning. we especially seek individuals who wish to specialize in medical data and applications. german language skills are not required to apply, but it is expected that speaking skills will be learned for daily interaction in a medical setting. * how to apply?* the following documents are needed for applications: ? a motivation letter ? a detailed cv ? email addresses of at least two references  interested applicants should send us the necessary documents via email to: applications at msrm.tum.de quoting ?postdoc application, h? in the e-mail subject line. the positions will be filled as soon as possible and only shortlisted candidates will be notified. preference will be given to applications received before july 31st, 2019. tum has been pursuing the strategic goal of substantially increasing the diversity of its staff. as an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, tum explicitly encourages nominations of and applications from women as well as from all others who would bring additional diversity dimensions to the university?s research and teaching strategies. preference will be given to disabled candidates with equal qualifications. international candidates are highly encouraged to apply. sincerely, ------------------------------------- saeed abdolshah, phd postdoc researcher rsi - chair of robotics science and systems intelligence munich school of robotics and machine intelligence technical university of munich he?str 134, 80797 munich email: saeed.abdolshah at tum.de phone: +49 89 289 29413 -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=sumdfl0fyy9akl8o5f6ndjuz656mpjfwaesds3hdxow&s=hdw2deddm0oek13w3pw6inu8yfkacln-t720wejnau4&e=

subject: marine robotics - perception,  navigation and control
content: the center of innovation for deep-sea environmental monitoring at the marum, university of bremen, germany has a an opening for a fully funded postdoctoral/research associate position in the area of  marine robotics - perception, navigation and control.  you will be part of the newly established center of innovation for deep-sea environmental monitoring at the marum, university of bremen, germany. the center was established to develop new solutions for sustainable and persistent deep-sea observations for emerging monitoring challenges in deep-ocean environments.  you should be interested in developing and applying cutting edge research towards the implementation of intelligent systems for autonomous deep-sea observations in a very challenging environment. we are currently developing a novel, highly manoeuvrable vehicle and are looking for an enthusiastic individual to join our team. we offer an exciting work environment with room to bring and explore your own ideas and collaborate with experts in the field of marine robotics and the marine sciences.  the position (tv-l13) will initially be limited to three years starting as soon as possible. tasks include but are not limited to: 	? participating in current research activities and shaping future research directions of the marine environmental technologies/deep-sea engineering group. 	? teaching and mentoring of students in computer science/mathematics and systems engineering. 	? support and initiate collaborations with new and existing partners, locally, nationally and internationally. 	? publication of research in leading scientific/technical journals and international conferences. 	? willingness to participate in multi-week open ocean research cruises. in particular we are interested in applicants that have a strong background and track record in one or several of the following research areas: artificial intelligence, machine vision, underwater communication, sensing, navigation and control. the applicant should work well in a multi-disciplinary team and have a keen interest to collaborate with marine scientists on a broad range of research questions. for the full announcement and more details please visit: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.uni-2dbremen.de_de_universitaet_die-2duni-2dals-2darbeitgeber_offene-2dstellen_detailansicht_joblist_job_show_postdoctoralresearch-2dassociate-2dposition-2dfmd-2d5854_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=8lkmjdjrtji05wua3fpr_i5a6jliu_ymcpfjeafyk_q&s=gpzl5qmpbp0_fe2ab0lupvmgsjhafyn58k6h4dfey9u&e=  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.uni-2dbremen.de_de_universitaet_die-2duni-2dals-2darbeitgeber_offene-2dstellen_detailansicht_joblist_job_show_postdoctoralresearch-2dassociate-2dposition-2dfmd-2d5854_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=8lkmjdjrtji05wua3fpr_i5a6jliu_ymcpfjeafyk_q&s=gpzl5qmpbp0_fe2ab0lupvmgsjhafyn58k6h4dfey9u&e= > looking forward to hear from you. ______________________________ prof. dr. ralf bachmayer marine environmental technologies/ deep-sea engineering  fb3 - mathematics/computer science university of bremen marum ? cen?ter for mar?ine en?vir?on?mental sci?ences leo?bener str. 8 d-28359 bre?men ger?many e-mail: bachmaye at uni-bremen dot de tel.: +49 (0)421/218-65890 fax: +49 (0)421/218-9865890

subject: computer vision engineer: object pose  estimation. dorabot.
content: we aim to gather the smartest robot enthusiasts to build a fully autonomous robot that can see and operate in the human environment, bring a true robotic future to life. for this position, we are looking for a talented software engineer with a deep background in vision and robot perception. *job description* 1. work with both 2d (rgb) and 3d (depth) raw perception data, sometimes even with other sensors who provides other modalities of percepts of the world. 2. solving vision tasks include but not limited to: ? vision sensor calibration (internal and external) ? identify and classify objects, generate bounding boxes, segment objects/ generate object masks ? measure object size in physical unit ? estimate and tracking object pose ? learn/ scan new objects in short time, possibly with surface reconstruction ? identify and read barcodes ? large-scale automatic data collection ? efficient (even autonomous) data labeling ? vision-based mapping, localization, and navigation 3. perform these tasks (if applicable) efficiently and robustly, against various lighting conditions/ under heavy occlusion/ while the relative pose between camera and object are changing as high speed/ multiple objects at the same time/ multiple cameras at the same time/ across different sensors/ deploy them on real robot hardware etc. 4. work on challenging scenarios such as the partially observable, sequential, dynamic, continuous, and unstructured environment. 5. the job might involve researching on a particular topic, reading papers, attending conferences, efficiently implementing algorithms on hardware, testing in the real environment, debugging, parallelization, sourcing sensors, and computing platforms, writing documents/ papers, generating patents, and other possible forms. * position requirement* 1. background in computer vision, computer graphics, image processing, machine learning or other related fields 2. proficient with c++ and python (knowledge and daily experience) 3. solid knowledge of computer vision theory with past experience of turning those theories into a robust program. 4. proficient with vision library: opencv, pcl, etc. 5. proficient in deep learning frameworks: tensor flow, keras, etc. 6. skilled with machine learning techniques, especially deep learning, reinforcement learning and transfer learning. *who we are* dorabot is an ai and robotics company developing loading, sorting, induction, and transportation solutions for market-leading logistics companies in the us and asia. headquartered in shenzhen and backed by some of the most prominent tech magnates, we're a tight-knit team of visionaries that live and breathe robotics. as e-commerce has exploded, order fulfillment still largely depends on traditional resources. dorabot's advanced solutions allow express couriers to automate, keep up with increasing demand, and fully embrace the future. unique among early-stage asian startups, dorabot employs people from over 10 different countries and views diversity as a key to their success. among dorabot?s employees are former ups executives and amazon robotics challenge champions from germany and australia. dorabot is currently piloting sorting solutions in the us, which will be rolled out to additional facilities in 2019, followed by our loading and transportation systems. our website: *www.dorabot.com <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.dorabot.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ytuu718g3oehz-qldhofcxqnjqzpgc0ypuzqpojuzto&s=drpxgg83pmpqvjq29g_4l2-jbr7a0-cpx4oihf5mftm&e= subject: a fully funded phd position at the bmw  ai and robotic centre of excellence and uni. of glasgow, in tactile robotics
content: an immediate fully funded phd position: in tactile perception and learning in robotics ======================================================================= we invite applications for a fully funded doctoral researcher position in the field of tactile sensing technology, tactile perception, exploration, robot grasping, and manipulation.   *   the successful candidate is expected to advance the state of the art of active tactile   perception, tactile object recognition, tactile in hand unknown grasp and object manipulation as well as tactile transfer learning.   *   the phd candidate will be hired by the bmw research department in munich, germany and will obtain it is degree from the university of glasgow, uk.   *   the candidate will spend its time at both bmw robotics and ai center of excellence and the university of glasgow and swill be supervised by dr. mohsen kaboli<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__scholar.google.com_citations-3fuser-3dsxv-5f8m4aaaaj-26hl-3den&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=mizdyzsundrzqsfs-gncqamvm2ydzdikazmwldxijaw&s=bt8dais-sb8kxxflklt2qseym12vtdggmhr3vfqrba8&e= > and prof. ravinder dahyia<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.gla.ac.uk_schools_engineering_staff_ravinderdahiya_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=mizdyzsundrzqsfs-gncqamvm2ydzdikazmwldxijaw&s=rbhnkuz7jfndrporgzwkn_j4o_wczooxd8gvhjufik0&e= >.   *   the bmw will cover all accommodation and traveling cost of the candidate while staying in glasgow.   *   the candidate will have a chance to collaborate with our other phd students within our newly accepted european marie cure itn projects, intuitive and inavigate.   *   the candidate will have chance to travel to top robotics and machine learning as well as sensor related conferences. required qualifications:   *   msc degree in electrical engineering, computer science mathematics, systems and control, or a related field from only top international universities.   *   strong theoretical or mathematical background, and a strong interest                in robotics and machine learning.   *   advanced programming skill in ros and c++ is mandatory.   *   having at least one publication in top ieee conferences such as icra, iros or top journals such as t-ro, auro, ral, and etc.   *   efficient communication skills in english. the position is full-time   *   cv with photo   *   one-page cover letter (clearly indicating available start date as well as relevant qualifications, experience and motivation)   *   university certificates and transcripts (both bsc and msc degrees)   *   contact details of up to three referees   *   list of publications   *   all documents should be in english and in one single pdf.   *   please send your application to:  mohsen.kaboli at bmwgroup.com<mailto:mohsen.kaboli at bmwgroup.com>  by 20th august 2019.   *   top application will be invited for an oral presentation and interview.   *   the project will start on october 1st 2019. --------------------------------------- bmw group dr.-ing. mohsen kaboli ai, robotics, and tactile intelligence research, new technologies, innovations parkring 19 85748 garching bei m?nchen subject: post-doc level research position in ai  & sensors for traffic automation @dlr, institute of transportation systems,  germany
content: dear researchers,  the institute of transportation systems at german aerospace center (dlr) has an open position in the area of artificial intelligence and sensor data processing. application fields are autonomous cars and trains, and ai-based surveillance for traffic safety research.  the job is located either in berlin or in braunschweig, germany. initial duration is 2 years. it includes the following topics: - research, concepts and application of machine learning methods and methods of artificial intelligence for environmental perception and ego-localization, - processing of sensor (raw) data, evaluation of sensors and possible applications - integration of sensors and data processing methods into automated systems, - conception, implementation and evaluation of scientific experiments with the institute's facilities. the job is addressed to researchers at post-doc level or with several years of experience and includes project acquisition and preparation of grant applications.  for a full description of the job and application process, please visit the following website: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.dlr.de_dlr_jobs_en_-2337120&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ei5n5pocxg-9d9tzncdzr9von8nnlpcxn_bvbb-0900&s=lprheia1_a79u6cgcltndo14mwldl7nt_8cssarvidm&e=  best regards franz andert ---------------------------- german aerospace center (dlr) institute of transportation systems | data management & knowledge discovery | rutherfordstr. 2 | 12489 berlin | germany dr.-ing. franz andert phone +49 30 67055-9655 | fax +49 30 67055-291 | franz.andert at dlr.de www.dlr.de/ts
